content: Rather disappointing experience compared to desktop browser (which is not flowless either). It's extremely difficult to search products by a specific category since many of them are burried deep inside other less relevant categories. Filtering is also a mess. There's no way to choose a specific price range and/or multiple brands. In addition, it's impossible to leave the seller's feedback after purchasing(!). Overall, it is usable, but sometimes it's easier to switch to a desktop browser...

Don't buy!!!! I'm 99.9% sure that this third party private seller is having these rebuilt or buying them with the forknowledge of and with non Microsoft certified hardware,which is not at all difficult to do. They will of course deny this. I am very familiar with hardware and the Xbox console. Even the interface is different and it lags doing the most simple of menu tasks . Not to mention the loading icons and colors are all slightly different to the trained eye. Amazon is USA,s ALIBABA.

This app is terrible. If I click on an Amazon link, the only thing that happens is a tiny grey bar shows up at the top of my screen that says "Amazon Shopping". Nothing else happens. This makes it impossible to shop on Amazon on my phone! I had to disable the app entirely (couldn't uninstall it because it says it came pre-installed, which is a lie, by the way. I remember manually downloading it because I thought it would be helpful. üôÑ)

Amazon consistently don't show all of my searching options, brands, models, and like items, until after I've settled on a 2nd best product. Frustrating shopping for products, when Amazon suppresses brands and models that Amazon don't favor. Please stop that suppression madness, and give me everything that I am looking for on the first try! I'm tired of having to Return items, because what I am really looking for Consistently shows up, immediately After I have made a 2nd best purchase!

Like it when it works, issues started today. It now will let me use one time, and then if I go back in it just keeps flashing between the front screen. It won't even allow you to attempt to type anything, because by the time you would even try to get to search bar, it flashes, repeatedly, non-stop. If I clear cache it will let me use app one time, and then if I go back in, it starts the flashing again.

If it ain't broke, don't fix it! I remember when studying for UI/UX design, one of the website layouts that we would see A/B (before/after) was Amazon's since they were the industry's leaders of e-commerce layouts. Many sites were modeled after theirs since it was set up the best! So they decide to change that? Why? To force people to accept the change as if it were necessary? When it wasn't at all! Also I hate their new(ish) app icon, it's awful. Amazon should be the BEST. Fire your staff

HATE the new layout. Why move the menu and buttons to the bottom after having them on top for what, a decade? New layout is clunky, unintuitive, and doesn't work like the old one did. This seems like change just for change's sake vs a real attempt to improve the app. 9 times out of 10 you'll learn that's a pretty stupid reason to change something. Take the hint Amazon. Ditch the update. It's absolutely horrible.

Considering the size and resources at Amazon's disposal this is a surprisingly bad app compared to say, eBay. Very slow and the auto correct on search is normally wrong and very frustrating, in that it will not allow what I want to search. No sorting, an older version did. One would expect sorting by price, ranking, popularity, etc. Instead i might get a list of 20,000 item starting with the paid placements. Trying to chevkout often sends me into a loop of the checkout screen.

Tired if all the products being "made in china" and if that wasnt the worst part, I had to disable the app, because I am unable to uninstall it. It wasn't on my phone when I got it, but now I cant remove it. I even to it to my provider and they were surprised as well since its NOT an app that is part of their pre-installed software, they recommend that I do a system reset to ensure it is completely gone from my phone. Amazon is starting to make me feel more and more like a chinese app/ service.

The Amazon App freezes a lot some of the built-in additional features don't work at all. The app is constantly closing on its own. Additionally, when trying to retrieve my saved list it doesn't scroll it's freezes. And then the app closes so it makes it really difficult to shop for hours at a time and make a purchase. There's a ton of bugs in this app

They trick you into ordering same order twice after order completed and then you have to deal with CS to try and get it returned. They're using 3rd party ads, usually directly from China, to buy under Amazon. However, if product is defective or wrong item, Amazon does not honor their warranty on products from them!! We're told we need to work directly with China. Good luck with that. Both orders from them were ignored trying to return defective item and wrong order sent.

Not a fan of constant changes. Different looks on ev2 device. The searching options are horrible. When I look for Philips iron I would like to see it first, not 6 or 7 down the line. When searching for a ¬£10 product I would actually like to see ¬£10 items and to sponsored post of various prices. The serach option is very bad. I use Google search instead to find what I need. It's quicker and much better.

Other than a way to permanently link to the smile.amazon,com of my choice, it's a okay app. Not enough filters for searching properly, widely wrong search results, and items wrongfully dropped out of results, sorts, and filters. Too many repeated sponsor products appear in results. Get in, get the item ordered, and get out or you can lose your day in the app. I can still get better deals on other sites.

Generally OK, but the "My orders" part is super flaky. ¬∂ Feature showing the driver's location is really cool, but SO FLAKY. Lately it shows me a map that is .75" high on my 5" screen, a mini postage-stamp -high strip. Above it there's "Now arriving today" and a picture of the item, and below it is‚Ä¶supposed to be the Update dlivery instructions/Share tracking buttons, but actually I just see all blank whitespace. If I scroll up (losing the map), then those buttons properly paint. So‚Ä¶bad refresh logic. Galaxy S7 Android 8.0.0. ¬∂ Notifications on package delivery are inconsistent. Since nobody rings the doorbell anymore, I feel like thieves can steal the package in the 30-60 minutes it takes to get a notification that the package is delivered. ¬∂ It's slow to get to your orders (click on the "person" icon, takes 10 seconds, then Your Orders takes another few). ¬∂ Track Shipment, See all Updates is too many clicks, with attendant slowness between. ¬∂ It's annoying to refresh. Should be able to pull down instead of going back twice and then going to See all Updates again. ¬∂ Should be able to Swipe Left/Right between items in the Shipment details screen, but you can't. Do some UX testing, Amazon!

Amazon app freezes, doesn't show all I'd search results. The company themselves sucks since covid started they say they don't let sellers jack up the prices, but they do. Items are either undeliverable or lost in the mail with no alert notification from Amazon, you don't find out unless you look to see where your package is. The drivers suck they either leave your package on the floor of the mail room, deliver it late, or return it because they are too lazy to walk up stairs.

The Amazon app used to be good, however, the updates to it has led me to using the website on PC more than mobile. The search results don't always list the categories in the filters, making browsing the app harder. I can't move items from one wishlist to another without the app crashing, so onto the actual website for that. The only thing it is good for is delivery updates, or if you actually know what you want to buy, otherwise the app isn't built for you to browse it.

Older version was better. New layout with menu at the bottom is in the way, too easy to launch something in error, especially if you have big big fingers. Also, as you scroll down to view items...loss of screen space. Even older APK version, it changes the interface within, better off of using the web. Changing stuff just to change, why? Keep the main menu a the top or make it an option within the App allowing us to choose! Giving options is a better customer experience!

Is anyone else having issues with this app? It will not let me switch to another credit card OR it will NOT let me choose free shipping. The screen gets lighter and it just keeps spinning like as if it's going to work, but it never does!! So, I have not been able to order anything from Amazon. I did Uninstall the app and then added it back, but still the same. So Aggravating!! üò°üò°

This app was working just fine until the last update. The home screen never has loaded right for me. Last night it started crashing every time I would try to open it and it would cause other apps to start crashing too, like my email and virus protection. I decided to uninstall and reinstall. It at least opened so I could do what I wanted to do last night, but this morning it started all over again so I uninstalled again. Now I can't get it to reinstall. I use this app ALL THE TIME! FIX IT!

Just recently the app started freezing. I thought it was my phone so I shut my phone off. Turned it back on, clicked on the Amazon app, and several times I got a message saying apps is not working, close the app, or want to send feedback. Twice I uninstall. I then realized the unsupected updates that took place has somehow messed up the ability for the app to open. Once the app is uninstalled and you open it, access to the app is fine. What type of updates warranted the app to malfuction?ü§î

TERRIBLE utter dumpster fire of an app and a company. My only advice is to go to a dang store. It's cheaper, more convenient, and just over all an easier and better experience. The app is constantly freezing, the prices are jacked up way to high, and the delivery fees are crazy. A $2 toy will have an $8 fee just to get it by NEXT WEEK or later. Once, it took nearly a month for a $5 stylus to come.Customer service: inconvenient. For some reason, when I look up $10 crocs, I get $100 shoes! CRAZY!

It's fine, more convenient than using a browser... however the font size/magnification is a mess. Instead of respecting the device font size and screen magnification settings, Amazon has its own fixed font minimum sizes. So if your device is set to large fonts, and the screen magnification is set to larger, then unlike every other app in existence, this one has massive fonts in some places, normal fonts in others, and it cuts off buttons in the app because they're not properly adaptive.

This new app format/structure is UGLY. Huge, bubbly shaped interface. The icons/tap options eat TOO much space, taking up 1/10 the screen sometimes. I miss the old format. I'm sure they are trying to streamline the navigations but yikes! This is WAY too simplistic and its even uninteresting to use. Like going from using from M.S. Word to M.S. Notepad. PLEASE put it back to how it used to be: the navigation bar on the top left with options v.s. the options at the bottom with bubble shape options.

New layout is just bad. Why put all buttons on the bottom? The Nav bars on top or side has been the industry standard since AOL for a reason! Also, there is no way to clear the search field once you search for an item. Kinda annoying.. Looks like someone in Amazon management wanted aesthetics above functionality and ease of use. I feel bad for the developers...

It's slow and laggy and it heats up my phone terribly (a LG G7 Thinq). Takes a good 3-4 seconds minimum to respond to any input. Freezes up often. Randomly jumps down to a popup or makes me accidentally click another link when I'm trying to just see the pictures of the product, or reviews. Somehow it's never crashed, but I haven't run the app long enough to see if it would. Think I'll stick to computer shopping, thanks.

Their market is so unregulated that you have no idea if any of your products are authentic or a cheap knock off. Reviews are flooded with paid/fake reviews. It's impossible to find a reliable product anymore. Also update your notification options. Theres a few things I want to be notified about and a lot other notifications that I dont care about. But the only option is all or nothing for notification options. Overall, terrible. Amazon is now a last ditch option when buying something

I love Amazon. They provide excellent customer service and I rarely have problems. Real issue is external vendors because that's where I have issues 100% of the time especially with stuff coming from far away so I have to make sure I am always buying stuff fulfilled by Amazon. Hate the new app icon btw. Looks super ugly so I had to remove it from my home screen.

Don't pay for prime if you're looking for fast shipping. Shipping used to be fast and efficient up until the last few months. The decline has been quick and steady. Almost everything marked "prime" takes 5+ days. Instead of the advertised 2 day shipping- Prime used to be amazing when I was looking for things in a pinch. Now it's literally useless. I mean I scrolled through 100+ items that match my search results and came up with nothing that had reasonable shipping for items marked as 'prime.'

Free Shipping Glitch. Every time I go to check out and click the Free Shipping option (not through Amazon prime) the whole thing greys out and it won't load anything or let me check out. It basically freezes. On a computer it's fine. On my phone, every time. It's becoming annoying. I'm not going to pay an extra ten dollars for shipping if I don't have to but having to open up my lap top rather than clicking a button on the app just to do that is first world problems to the max.

Their user interface is clunky, ugly and ineffective for searching for exactly what you want. You cannot interact with sellers directly. Listings give almost no info about the specific item you're buying, and their are almost never photos of the actual item you're buying, only stock photos. These problems are most apparent when buying used items. So many better outlets including ebay and etsy or direct from websites. The ONLY thing they are good for is user reviews. I'll never buy there again.

"ADD TO LIST" function is very very slow! I select a product, scroll down and tap "ADD TO LIST" nothing happens. I tap multiple times, and it takes 4+ seconds to respond. I use the list functionality a lot, and it's functioned poorly on this app for as long as I can recall. To add 10 individual items to lists, takes a very long time. It's too inconvenient to try to inform amazon of this problem any other way besides just leaving a low review.

Since last update I literally cannot use the app. When I open it, it says "UH-OH Something went wrong on our end". Nothing works, not even any of the buttons. It only keeps saying the above message. This happens over 4g as well as over WiFi connections. This has been going on for a good while now. Makes me wonder does Amazon actually know there is a huge number of its users that are unable to use their app? hard to imagine a billion dollar company not realising this.

New UI is terrible! Having the main menu always visible is no longer there. Sometimes it disappears all together. Constantly have to back out of current sub-menus in order to access the main menu. Sometimes the sub-menu loops and is unable to get back to the main menu without exiting the whole app. There are instances when I open Amazon links from messages and it doesn't direct properly unless the app was already open, so the links has to be opened twice. Terrible glitchy new version.

Prior to the new UI update, I could easily navigate and purchase items I was interested in, now the UI is now garbage; it has been oversimplified to the point of being unintuitive. Instead of a sidebar with useful options listed, there are now just three buttons at the bottom. I'm now stuck pressing button after button trying to find menus that were previously one click away. And if I want to go to the home page, I can't just press home, I have to back out of the menus I entered previously.

App works quite well, and I find the service is VERY good. It seems like the selection has been getting a little thin lately. Will never replace shopping in-store. Still, a very easy and enjoyable online shopping experience. One pet peeve: I HATE the new icon! I get that brown resembles a plainly-wrapped parcel, but it's ugly and fails to catch my eye in the jumble of other icons. What was wrong with Amazon Blue? Oh, and stop making paid shipping the default when free has been earned!

Update: 2 months later, still the same. I try to send to a pickup location and I get those annoying "oops, something went wrong" pop ups. I can't buy expensive stuff in secret anymore, my wife keeps finding the packages and sending them back! vvvv ORIGINAL POST vvvvv It works about 60% of the time, I've been getting error messages for months. I tried closing the app and reopening but that doesn't work. I end up just waiting a few hours and trying again.

With the recent changes I do like the three options at bottom to navigate. I prefer the prev frame by frame of product photos, not how they slide now, skipping over pics. When I attempt to go back to prev products that I've recently viewed as before, the app randomly takes me back to the main page, then back to the previous item, or it completely backs me out of the app. I do like the prev viewed option but it doesn't go very far back. The new feat. are not more convenient at all.

UI update is awful. Top bar moved to bottom. Things I used to be able to access in one touch require navigating sub menus. Bad usability decisions like this from Amazon are disappointing. I'm finding the app to be frustrating to use with this change and there's no positives. There's nothing I like about this update, everything is a step in the wrong direction. If I could revert I would. I hope Amazon reverses this update.

I love & use Amazon for so many things, like getting my energy drinks sent to my house. But the app freezes like crazy. If I'm looking at a product w multiple variations it'll freeze up entirely as I click to see the options. Or it'll make the item pic sorta hazy so I can't see the color properly. Or I can't scroll thru the pics to see multiple angles. Sometimes just the item pic freezes, but I can still click the bottom icons. And then it'll just spin trying to load a screen. Needs fixing.

I love amazon and have been using it for years. However the new site navigation is horrible. You can't just go and scroll through all the products anymore, you have to go by page which gets annoying. The filters are way harder to navigate and irritating, if you want to switch categories it will clear all of your other filters (size, color ect.) Which you then have to find again. Really wish Amazon would go back to its previous format.

Honestly, Amazon has become disappointing. Speaking to the quality of the company, I've had more and more concerns with their business practices in recent years. As far as the app experience goes, I've been finding it difficult to use. The app is basically a web wrapper for the most part. It's not well integrated with newer features of Android, and it can be incredibly slow at times. I would have expected better from such a large, high value company.

New update caused issues with browsing options. When you click on what you want to look into further, trying to explore other options (different colors of item, sizes, shapes, and so on), it doesnt load. You arent able to see the picture clearly, swipe them, or enlarge them. The only option is to purchase and you are unable to save to favorites. Its very frustrating. Please fix soon! Thanks!

Can't switch no more, between US and Canada, after a last update of the application!!! It was a breeze to switch between, in a previous version. I am not an easy to confuse user and I have wasted few minutes looking for the darn switch option, still had not found! Just how evil SW guys can be to just change interface for millions of users, just like that; completely silly, irresponsible, evil and vicious!!!!!

Would be better if it responded the first three times you clicked on something. It does my head in when I try to click, for example "add quantity" and it doesn't respond, only to then click on something completely random. Or if i add something to a list, it takes several goes before it comes up with anything. I get frustrated with this a lot.

Not a fan of the new update... The font is all extra large. I haven't figured out how to change it and it makes the app more difficult to navigate. The tab system is different, but not problematic. That is until the bottom menu options go away. When they disappear, you can't get back to the main page without hitting the back button a billion times through everything you've looked at while in the app.

This app is a chore to use. It's tedious to find anything unless you specifically search for it. It forces unrelated sponsored products in the results further adding to the frustration. It also keeps recommending I sign up for prime even though I already have it... Simple tasks drag out due to a confusing unintuitive interface. I'm really surprised at how bad it is.

I have been using the Amazon app for what seems like "forever" and I have never had a complaint. The app has always been easy to use. However, the most recent update that occured in early March 2021, is horrible. They have not only moved the toolbar to the bottom, but also increased the text size so large that it essentially minimizes useful key features within that toolbar. This makes the time to look for specific categories and features much longer. Stop 'fixing' unbroken things.

Who ever decided it was a good idea to change the app layout into this convoluted mess is a complete idiot. Can't stand it, and as a result won't be purchasing as often from the site. Your loss, my bank accounts gain. Hey Amazon here's a tip... You should want to make it easier for your customers, not more difficult. The app was more than fine the way it was.

Ive used the Amazon app on my phone for many years, and its generally been great. This said a new version has come out in April 2021 and since then its awful. The general feel on you phone is that your using a desktop website view, where not everything fits on the screen and excessive scrolling and clicks are needed to find what you need. One of the main benefits of amazon is ease of buying what you need. Its likely to mean less casual browsing for me and consequently a lower overall spend.

The UI of Amazon.sa has been changed and it's not user friendly as the previous one. Also, in the old UI there was a "Important messages for items in your Cart" button clicking that would show you the change in price for the items. The new update has made changes hidden and only shows the name of the items without showing the amount of price change or the new and old price. That feature was useful to me and the change seems just business oriented. I'm considering cancelling my Prime membership.

I don't understand how anyone with an android device can use this app. I've had 3 different brands of phone and this app has never worked on any of them. If I click on any item it flips to the "uh-oh, something went wrong" page almost immediately. It is completely unusable, I only have it for delivery notifications. Wish Amazon would fix it, but I don't have high hopes since I've had this problem consistently for several years.

I love using the app it's so much easier until I get to the checkout. I select free delivery, as I have spent the required amount, and it goes dim and the circle of death appears and it's just turning and turning and turning. I end up having to go to the webpage to checkout. It is so annoying, what's the point in the app if it doesn't function as it should. I don't use prime, waste of money, and still get stuff delivered extremely quickly.

It's becoming more & more of an annoyance in recent months. The search functionality was fairly good, but the app seems to have gone the same way as the browser version. Irrelevant search results appear. Filtering them creates even more weird results, & Amazon do nothing to sort it. The annoying "we thought you might like" notifications, seemingly this cannot be turned off. Reviews are sometimes not even for the exact item you're looking at. Time to sort out these problems across all platforms.

The App is so slow, freezes up, nothing like the app used to be before they changed the look of it a month or so ago. I finally gave up and use the mobile version with my browser on my phone. It's fast, never freezes and has all of the content that the app has without eating up a lot of space on my phone. The only thing you don't get are notifications of your delivery being 10 stops away. I can definitely live without that.

What happens to "see more"? If Amazon is looking for me to spend less time browsing, then the latest update is great! The new interface got rid of the "see more" option for most suggestions. Leaving me to search myself or only look at four that may or may not actually meet my needs.... Go back to the previous interface, it worked better and was more engaging.

This app had been nice to use for some time. But no longer, as all I see is a blank screen after going back from a product screen to the screen which shows all available products. I uninstalled/reinstalled the app and cleared the cache, but still get a blank screen. Only thing to do is go to the Amazon main page and start searching again. I originally gave this app 2 stars because it had problems with blank previous screens. That's been fixed.

I've used this app on my phone for many years without any issues. Now ever since the recent update, with the new logo, it continually crashes within 10-15 seconds after loading making it totally useless. I've uninstalled and reinstalled several times without any improvement. What was wrong with the previous version? Don't fix what wasn't broken. This latest version appears totally broken and needs a fix quickly.

I shop on Amazon a lot. But this last app update is a disaster. I don't really like the new interface, but I know I'll adjust. The main issue is glitchy things. I can't scroll through my wishlist anymore. It's stuttering and won't actually scroll down. The whole app in general is so slow to load now and going between sections of the app is a mess.

Definitely not as user friendly after the update. I have constantly used Amazon for most of my shopping needs, especially with how easy the app was to navigate. Now I'll probably be switching where I do most of my online shopping. Bring back the side bar piece that has all of my settings, lists, just everything in one place instead of taking the bottom half of the screen up.

Most of the time recently, when I go to change the shipping speed to the Free Delivery option (which is never the default), the app locks up (looks like it's loading but never actually does anything). I have to go onto the desktop computer in order to complete my order with Free Shipping. This makes the app fairly pointless. I see this has been mentioned in several other reviews but has not yet been fixed.

The products are good quality, never had any complaints. The issue I'm having and it's only been lately is the app. It takes longer to load and I have great internet service so it's not that. The app seems to freeze sometimes to the point when I was trying to add something to my cart I had clear the app from my recent apps and start all over again. It's just frustrating because I pay for prime and apparently I'm paying for an app to work decently half the time hopefully.

I used to love the app, it was really easy to use, intuitive etc. The latest version is terrible. Lots of bugs, including not being able to scroll through my wishlist, it keeps resetting to the top. The menu of "departments" is in a really weird order, and seems to be based on what Amazon want to flog rather than alphabetically or based on what the customer typically buys. Since the update, I've logged on less and less. Please reverse the changes!

The NEW LAYOUT in this app just made my shopping experience more difficult and cumbersome. Is that what you want Amazon? ... for people to stop using this app? Well, it worked. I don't like the changes you just made to the user interface. Those four buttons at the bottom of the screen are too close to the Android controls for my phone and I keep tapping the wrong ones. The cart belongs in the top right corner like everyone else does it, not at the bottom. CHANGE IT BACK TO THE WAY IT WAS!

Amazon is my go to on line shopping app. I never have any issues with it. But after this last update, it's been super glitchy. The pictures dont open up right away, the ratings disappear and then come back, while looking at color options they also disappear then I have to wait for it to pop up again. Man, this is annoying and frustrating. Please fix it! I love Amazon but I wont give it the 5 star rating until it's fixed.

The Amazon app used to be easy to navigate. Since the update, it is awkward and more difficult to quickly locate things, like 'orders' which had been in the same place for years. Also, since September, other item options are un-clickable. You cannot select them to view, only order without seeing the product. The new app is terrible!!! Please fix!!! I have found that I just back out, abandon the whole idea, and skip ordering altogether. I'll shop elsewhere until it's fixed!

Edit: It just keeps getting worse-pages won't load,search box won't clear,and the worst, clicked Proceed to Checkout and APP went straight to Order Confirmed! Not cool. I've been using this APP for years and it's always been good. The new bottom site navigation is awkward and backwards - going down to "scroll-up", instead of "drop-down" from the top to continue down, doesn't make sense. Also, it's too close to device navigation, which are generally located at the bottom of most devices.

Not a fan of the new UI, but it's decent. The really bad thing about the last update, is items that have choices are now broken. You can still choose the other options, but once there, can't scroll through or click on the picture to see the multiple pictures. Seems to be every other option on a page will have this issue. Please fix this ASAP. If I can't see all the pictures to compare, I won't buy. My household approaches 6k spent yearly on Amazon.

Unlike using Amazon through a browser, this app is incredibly frustrating, especially if you are trying to search for products. Unless you know exactly what you want, search results are often useless and you are liable to buy a completely inappropriate product for your needs. It's almost like they just want to sell you something and don't care beyond getting your money. Also the pages and pages of ads for products are tiresome to scroll through, and make it difficult to do product research.

New interface and navigation is awful. You search for a specific item and get everything but. Product names are cut off so if you are looking at several products from a company you can only go off of the picture. Filters don't seem to work, especially the price filter? When searching for something specific, like office heels for women, I kept getting slippers and tennis shoes? Way too clunky to navigate now. I've been with Amazon for awhile and wish they would go back to the old app interface.

Not a fan of the new update for one. But especially, lately, the service quality has gone way down. I have had a few instances of packages not showing up at all. I left a review in one such instance. It wasn't rude just honest about my experience and Amazon wouldn't allow it. Disappointing. I should be supporting smaller businesses more anyway.

The company is easy to order through and quick to fix any issues that arise. However the update to the app is awful. Instead of one or two clicks to check on my orders it's nearly 12. I used to have a large map once the driver was within 10 stops. Now I have about 1/8th of an inch that they jam the entire city map onto making the feature useless. The last design was easy to use this is like they had a brain storming session to figure out how to make it as difficult and terrible as possible.

The sales part of the app is the best e-commerce app out there. The customer service is not. They can not find all the mysterious charges anyone with a long relationship with Amazon has. It is all outsourced so language is a problem. Their prices fluctuate so much depending on who you get, they don't always grant price adjustments even if the item is within a return period. (I once got denied a USD $0.50 adjustment, so I sent it back, and bought it again. So much for being pro-environment.)

Definitely laggy. You think it's your phone, but I just bought a new one and this app STILL freezes and lags. I don't think its received an update for a long time, I wish they'd fix it because it's convenient otherwise. But it's frustrating when you want to zoom in on items or delete things from your list. And it takes forever for items to load. Amazon, update your app already!

The app keeps freezing and each item takes 5 times longer to load. I can't back out or do anything until it unfreezes. And that happens in every screen for every item. I have to go do something else while waiting and waiting! Very frustrating and inefficient. It's faster to get in my car and go shopping at a store for what I need...

Love to shop on Amazon, but the app needs fixing. Lately, when on an item multiply color available, can't bring up the next, only a faded color version shows. Other issue, is a deal breaker. Many times getting just a blank page, as the item trying to show up. Only a restart of my tablet make it work, but happening too often. For years, never had any issues, but this is way too annoying. Please Amazon, pay attention!

The newer layout is horrible. I can't move between apps, leaving amazon open in the background to go back to what I was doing because when I do it even a second later it refreshes to the amazon home screen every time losing my place to what I was looking at, in the middle of a search, or in the middle of check out. It no longer holds your place. All the most used options that used to be right on top like past orders, your digital media purchases, wallet/payments you now buried in Narnia.

Lots of features missing. Cannot sort Saved for Later. List interface is slow and clunky and lacks features. Email and interaction with vendors is atrocious and almost useless. Layout is dorky and wastes functionality and space, does not display what you need it to, where you need it to. Too much advertising for other products. General search for products is difficult. Not many search tools allowed. Truly second rate programming. Billions of dollars, and this is the best they can do?

What happened? I have never had a single issue with the Amazon app. Now for the last 3 weeks it cannot open without immediately crashing. Yes I cleared memory and cache as well as uninstalling restarting and reinstalling the app. Get it together Amazon. I spen way to much money to have any issues at all with your app. It has now been over a month and still no action regarding this app crashing. Still no fix for the constant crashing. It has now been 6 weeks.

New update is horrible! They changed the UI and it freezes constantly. I ordered things by a√ßcident due to the app freezing and I couldn't exit properly. It messed up my shipping options when I did order as it shows changed but it doesn't actually execute the change on the backend. Not impressed with this new version. Too many bugs! I'll uninstall and order from my browser for the time being.

The apps has lost its basic function. Want to search by category forget it. Amazon is trying so hard to be everything they forget the one thing that was helpful. Same with Amazon Music...they removed the Genre grouping in that app. I don't want to be sold something...I want to search for something to buy. The app is just as horrible as their delivery service these days. I now buy more product locally than in the past 10 years...it is less frustrating.

I've had this app for years, but recently the Compare prices feature has stopped working altogether from my list. When I add it to the shopping cart that's the only way it works. It isn't the products that's the issue, it just one day stopped working. Tracking packages feature could also use some work. It had trouble scrolling and keeps popping up that "something went wrong" when clicking list or products.

Always have problems with the filters, besides the ads pushing products all the time, the filter system does not work. Try adding a few options to filter and what you get is a total reset instead. It does not narrow down on anything, the selected options are not selected and what is displayed in price range is not what you select. It just does whatever. And so many items of the same, i prefer other apps when shopping online because of this problem. The app does not help you find anything.

The app itself is fine. Easy to navigate and place orders. It does not however help you to contact Amazon in regards to their delivery drivers, it gives you a short list of what to choose from. Now, during Winter it was frustrating, but understandable when they left packages out by the mailboxes on the roads, safety and all that. However, there is no snow on the ground now and packages are still being left by mailboxes at the road. This just screams "steal me" making it easier for porch pirates

Since the last big UI update, the app has become terrible. It's become terribly slow to navigate (just trying to go to my orders takes a lot longer than it used to). Trying to read reviews on items is a chore as well now, as every time I open a review with pictures, it shows either the text or the pictures, but when I expand the text it just disappears completely most of the time. All the animations are also very laggy.

the app works great the majority of the time! But I dislike some changes such as the inability to "contact us" by email directly from the order summary page. Or chat with a live person. Having to hit next to scroll through results, it used to load in one continuous list...which reminds me, the filters could be stronger for searches. Can't filter by est delivery date for one example...for such a huge site one would think filters and sorting would be the best in the business. I still like the app

The app is definitely a bit clunkier, but searching items is such a bad experience, there's a lean into a "minimalistic" approach where you don't see full item names, the Free Delivery option etc. And it's just ugly. The worst part is your search results look normal until you click for the next page, then it changes over to this ugly new interface. Blegh. At least give me an option to change it back.

Never had an issue with the app, really enjoyed it.. but recently started experiencing issues with scrolling through my wishlists. It gets glitchy and doesn't want to scroll down, so I'm unable to see and view items I've saved which is extremely inconvenient. Updates are all up to date. I'm disappointed, I'm better off using a web browser. If this isn't a problem for you though, I highly recommend.

I have been a loyal customer for what 4 plus years, I have nothing wrong until this new updates keeps cutting me off showing the dogs saying "oops sorry no connection " never had that happened to me before and it's getting very annoying. I miss the old version. The prices are great, the shipping is taking too long to, and maybe you guys should ship them faster. I really like you guys, because the price is awesome than the other places I try order from. Also I have trouble "checking out".

The app is functionally fine. I've been using it for more than a decade and the recent change that has moved to navigation to the bottom of the screen is just so awkward to me. The previous, upper left hand menu access was not only familiar because of the apps implementation but also because that's where the vast majority of mobile web sites place the expandable menu.

Crashes continually on Android 7, same as many previous versions. I have an old ad free app that worked just fine I will have to reinstall. I'm always willing to try a new version but when it's worse than the previous then you have to go back. As of 8/8/21, still continues to crash on Android 7.1.1 even with this most recent update and even seems worse than the previous update. Have to keep going back to an old version of the app.

Hate it! Scrolling isn't as smooth. Trying to look at my wish list and I can't get past the first 2 items. It takes forever for an image to load. Adding something on a wishlist is hard as well. The heart takes forever to turn red to add an item. Then you can't view any items because the wishlist does not work. Ever since the update, this app has gotten worse.

This new look to the app is not an improvement. The bottom orientation is unintuitive to the previous left hand side version. And the icon is so boring and ugly I've removed it from my homepage and thereby decreased the usage. I'll check back in after you've played with it all over again like we all know that you will in another few months. Sad design failure.

I don't if it's just my phone, but every time I put it on in the morning and it doesn't matter how long I leave it, when I open this app it always opens up to a white screen and does nothing then I have to shut the app down completely, then re open it and it works, very frustrating üò§. My phone is S9 plus android 10 If it's the app hope for a fix please. Thanks.

I have been trying to buy items for the past 2 day and it always says "revise payment" so I preselected the payment method (multiple times) and it kept having the same issue. I went and bought another pre paid card and tried buying something and it still has the same issue. I'm very furious about this and hope they fix thos problem soon. Maybe it's just my phone but it most likely is the app having issues. Never the less, when I am able to purchase items, it work and delivery was spot on mostly

The update looks like Amazon went backwards 10 yrs. It looks old, outdated, chunky. The last one is soooo much nicer. Easy flowing and smooth sailing. When I am looking at the updated format, i feel as if i am being blocked and want to just navagate right out of there and buy nothing. The previous format just makes me want to spend money. Change it back, please!

Once again congratulations to the app developers that have ruined something that used to work. The new app update has ruined the interface and made it awkward, clunky and even easier to freeze. I used to love the Amazon app because it was seamless and offered an effortless transition between the pages. Now, impossible to find which links will take you where you want, constant freezing and of course, the inability to go back to your account screen after a search because the toolbar disappears.

Please change the app back to the old interface. This new version is laggy, and a pain in the butt to navigate. Why change something that works? Users do not want to learn the new interface. As someone who shops almost exclusively on amazon 10s of thousands of dollar$ a year... I will be finding an alternative until the app is fixed. Bad choice Amazon!

This app needs a lot of work as it shuts down constantly when I'm trying to use it. Also once it shuts down and reopens, it does not go back to the place that you were at. This results in having to start all over again and refind what you were looking at(which isn't always very easy). More than half the time once I find the item again, it then shuts down once more. It frustrates me to the point I either stop shopping all together, or I use the web browser.

You would think that a multi-billion dollar company could afford to run a decent app! It used to run super smooth, but anymore if you're on it more than a few minutes, it becomes laggy, glitchy, and non responsive. Browsing and comparing products has become a nightmare because you either can't look between different colors or sizes, or it won't pull up the option to save things to a list. So frustrating

The new update is horrible. Basically useless üòï. Super slow, takes forever to load cart or my account. Previous version was fine. Fast, worked well and had very fey crashes. In 5 minutes trying to use this new version I am ready to scream. I have a note 10 plus and have never had an issue with the app before. Please get this corrected and push the update asap!

App developers changing the whole look and feel of a well established and liked app is one of the dumber things they can do. Amazon being the largest retailer in the world have done just that, they should change it back, but of course they won't. So, they'll just have to live with all the negative reviews they're going to get. It's a shame, but the new UI truly is poor, requiring more taps to get anywhere and moving things to different places, most people don't like relearning an app over again.

Addition to my previous review I now find when I open the app on my Samsung S9+ all I'm faced with is a white screen and it stays that way until I hit the back button. What are your developers playing at Amazon? I think they are having a laugh at your expense! Please sort this ASAP. NEW design and layout is a 'massive fail'. It's confusing, messy, counterintuitive and just plain annoying. Please return it back to a previous state as the old saying goes "if it aint broke don't fix it" thankyou.

Mininalsim has ruined the user interface. When one used to be able to get an overview over their orders and other things easily, the app now separates things in separate tabs, resulting in heavily reduced accessibility. Also the recommendations. Click on a product once; and now you get spammed with it for ever. Ordered something you only need once? You must be a huge fan, buy more of it. This wouldn't be a problem if editing your history or tuning your recommendations wasn't so convoluted.

Don't love it, don't hate it. The app works all right, but sometimes it gives me an error after loading the page I want. Being a prime member not everything is delivered in the promised 2 day delivery. Even if you check prime when searching, the search tool is awful at filtering that out so when you get to check out, you're annoyed and disappointed and have to look again for an actual prime item or risk not getting the third party seller item if shipping isn't ridiculous. It's just all right.

I like shopping with Amazon, but I do get tired of them messing with the interface all the time. A recent change I absolutely hate is the addition of an ad bar at the top of the app that reloads every single time I click on anything and I have to wait until the ad fully loads before I can even use the page. It's not as though every page doesn't already have a dozen featured product ads. Why do I need more ads for other products slowing down my use of the entire app? Whose idea was that?

DO NOT BUY PRIME, it is a scam, it no longer delivers on its claims on having two day or less delivery, and beside that, all the other "benefits" are obsolete. Prime video, music and such still require individual purchases of items, it's a waste of money. Not to mention, they conveniently failed to register me canceling my subscription and still charged me money, then proceeded to tell me that in order to cancel their automatic deductions, I'd have to cancel the membership early with no refund.

I've been using this app for a really long time. Suddenly its broken. Crashes before it opens. I've cleared the cache, cleared the data. Completely relogged in. It worked once after that. Now crashing repeatedly. I cant even give feedback because that part crashes too. When it works, I love it. But right now, I got nothing. Cant even file a report.

Was great, then they changed it. It was perfectly fine the way it was and now all the navigation is at the bottom of the page. Quit changing major stuff like that without giving people the option to keep it the way it was. It's really freakin annoying to have to relearn how to navigate at an app that you've used for years and it's a standard to have navigation at the top of an app or website.

The updated app experience makes it more difficult to find products that were easy to find in the past, filtering is more difficult, and the overall experience is just worse. When this was simply a front end to their website, it was easy to find the things I wanted and search categories with ease, but now some categories don't show up at all versus the website, and others are bare ones. Overall this is another step in the wrong direction for Amazon.

This used to be a really good app but the new user interface is terrible. As a developer myself I recognise it's important to think about UX, and this app doesn't do that at all. Navigating to specific categories is really confusing and generally very slow. I'd like to see the original flyout menu system come back which was much easier to use. Also, I wasn't able to find a way to disable the autoplaying Prime Video advert on the home screen? Very annoying and distracting.

Regular user of this app. I don't like that they've taken away the ability to search the marketplace for different price points from different sellers for the same product. The lowest price is shown but doesn't include P&P. The different price points also don't sync up when compared to access through a computer. Mainly using app for quick search and tracking my orders.

Recent updates does not allow you to browse different color choices and/or options, swiping through photos is unreliable. Many times trying to swipe through pictures, the app won't even respond. I now tend to just open the web browser and browse Amazon that way. Pretty worthless update. I'm using a Pixel 4A, and it is not my phone. I have no trouble browsing the web version of the Amazon site.

There's something wrong w/this app after updates. It's like it is very UNSTABLE when attempting to view an item. Like the images or something, they disappear & the screen FLUTTERS badly at the top. Unless you can scroll just right, you can't even view the thumbnails, or price, & its empty where the large photo is supposed to be. If you scroll all the way to the top of any page, it will always flutters so badly you can't see anything at all. Just using the app is an annoyance now. NOT FLUENT.

Since the new march 2021 update the app is super slow and doesn't load things properly, it can take over 10 mins to load some item pages at times, and that's with good internet. They've also moved the bar to the bottom of the screen which is in an awkward place, especially as keeping track of items in your basket is easier when in the top corner, not under your fingers/thumbs when trying to scroll.

The app used to be great, working flawlessly. The latest update however has introduced a raft of bugs: the app freezes half the time on opening, the tracking map is now so tiny it's useless, some of the buttons just don't work. Not sure exactly why Amazon found it necessary to reinvent the wheel and fix something that wasn't broken, but I hope they fix this asap.

Love Amazon shopping, but this app is a disaster and always has been. It's never gotten better in all the years I've used it despite the updates. It's slower than the old dial-up internet, it frequently freezes, scrolling often isn't smooth, buttons aren't always responsive, and the pictures and videos not loading is a common occurrence. With all the money Amazon makes, you'd think they'd invest in a functional app.

App crashes. This app upsets me, because it now uses bait and switch. I can't believe amazon has resorted to this. It places buttons required to be pushed in clear view, but now resorts to pushing the button down and replacing it with an advertisement just as you select it. It has also decreased the number of items it will show in a search just so they can advertise more. For one of the largest companies in the world, it has resorted to playing games with your time.

I have been using the Amazon prime app for several years, before 2021 the app started taking a long time to load then would lock up and had to be closed then at the first of the year the app wouldn't even load . I cleared the cache , no change, uninstalled the app and reloaded and still locks up during loading and I have to close it. Amazon's programming has changed for Android users and must be FIXED if they want continued sales. I will wait till the end of Feb 2021 to try to use it again.

This is such a buggy app that it is unbelievable that it comes from a company as big as Amazon. The app is slow and takes forever just to do the simplest things. With each update I hope they fixed the problems with the app, but they never do. They just add stupid features no one asked for and leave the bugs. And this isn't app specific, but if an order qualifies for free shipping, the free shipping option should be the default instead of having to search for the option to opt in to it.

been using Amazon for years now... a few times I've had issues with an item they rectified the situation right away. The one time a little over a year ago, they didn't even acknowledge the situation, so I lost out not only on the item I was trying to purchase, but also the payment made to seller for said item. Several attempts were made to contact both seller and Amazon with no response.

I absolutely love this app!! I actually had my very first problem with a couple things that I ordered this month and only 1 out of 4 items have been shipped to me and received, but still missing a few things! NOTHING told me that they would be late in the mail... I'm very shocked because this never happens to me, ever!! I've spent well over $800.00 this month alone, on the Amazon Shopping App!!!

They make it easy to spend, but hard to get your product or refund when they mess up. Stopped receiving my orders 3 months ago even though everything kept saying delivered. After a lot of bs got my money back. This week ordered something small to see if I'd get it. Got a delivery! It was scarves I ordered 3 months ago. Called about the item I actually ordered. Have to wait 7 days while they "investigate" for a refund. The poor service isn't worth the supposed convenience. Rather go to the store

Takes a while to load things. There are problems that I thought were just from my end, but they have continued past me getting a new phone and downloading the app. For example, random crashes, and not being able to add items to my lists (even after clicking on the "add to list" button a million times -- this persists on different phones, too). Also pictures of items not loading sometimes. Kind of annoying, with all the money Amazon has, these should be very easy fixes.

Why changes?????? Now the vertical scrolling sticks and bounces back instead of scrolling smooth like it did previously. The horizontal scrolling is so sensitive that it's almost impossible to scroll right and Left without moving the entire screen up and down. The new icon menu is so confusing to find what you are looking for... it's not alphabetical or customizable. I wish developers would just leave perfectly working apps alone!

What happened Amazon? Last few months this app has become plagued with bugs. Deleting/moving items in lists can take up to a minute for the 3 steps! Pages will disappear, and upon an auto-reload, it defaults to the home page üòí Search results are a joke at times, the auto-correct does nothing to "correct" your search terms half the time. Someone, please, consider an overhaul of the front-end of this app. Trying to scroll within lists causes "jumping", where it wants to scroll the other way! Ugg.

Worked perfectly before update. After update... Pop-up shows activity. Go to pop-up and the program opens but never reveals activity. Just continually tries to load screen. If you go to the app manually, only parts of what you select will load, otherwise just continually trying to load page. Pretty much worthless. Roll it back or please fix the issues. After a bit of pages trying to load we get the dog page saying uh-oh, something went wrong on our end. Thank you.

Was great until the recent "update." They reformatted the UI to have the options at the bottom of the screen. Checking the status of an order now takes two extra steps and has a rather significant lag to open the order status menu. Sure, it's a first world problem, but I don't understand why they change things that don't need to be changed.

Poorly designed with poor service and poor customer support. I lost access to my phone number and was hoping I could get my account back by contacting customer support - too bad that you have to be signed in to contact them. I created a second account and wanted to add it into the app, the app just loads indefinitely and nothing happens. I will never understand how such a huge company can get away with some of the worst designed apps on the internet.

Amazon customer for 15+ years and enjoyed using the app until recently. After last update app completely froze. It did not respond to any buttons. I restarted the app, cleared the cache, turned my Samsung phone off and back on. Still no response. Was impossible to delete app for reinstallation. Eventually the app reverted to the previous addition on it's own without the smile and worked. An update appeared in the Play Store. I am afraid to update for fear of reoccurrence of problem.

Although we utilized the prime membership heavily during the pandemic, I have to admit that we used it quite a bit before and most likely will afterward. Prices can be a bit higher than other places but the "free" shipping that costs $99/year more than makes up for it. I've started adding things to my cart that are only wanted, not needed or a necessity and save for later as you'll get a notification in those items when the price goes up or down. Also, keep a look out on items that have coupons!

Dreadful Update since Sept 2021. The app is now slow, common uses come up slowly and are not logically placed. I've been using the Amazon app for years and this is by far the poorest update ever. For example, finding order updates is now a multi step process and slow. I don't see any advantages of the new UI. The logo change last year was poorly executed as well.

Update 06/11/21: App is still awful. The menu font has been fixed, but bottom bar placement, and obscure submenus make using and find things difficult. Bring back the hamburger menu! UI update is awful. Menu bar at the bottom with buttons placed in inconvenient locations. Not excited about this. It makes using the App frustrating. Not only that, but the font in the menus are now huge and discombobulated. I'd rather use desktop view in mobile browser than this trash

What idiot thought it was a good idea to put the menu across the bottom of the app where the phone controls are??? Stupid move. I'll start using my laptop more now and avoiding the app. As a side note, the app crashes more now (freezes up when trying to go from different pages or scrolling). So that's just another reason to avoid using it. I wish developers would stop screwing with an app when it was fine before all this. Now it's just a hot mess.

I've found the search results often aren't accurate, and if I opt for filtering it as cheapest first, maybe with other filters too, it misses some results I had before which are cheaper. And, if I change any one filter, I need to order it again from cheapest first. It's a simple a major thing to sort for a big company. If things in my basket moved to purchase, it'll often automatically move my items to more avoidable expensive delivery options. If changed back to free, it'll load for too long.

Would really like there to be a receipt for orders. I'm old and actually balance my checkbook, so unless I remember to grab a screenshot of my order page, I have no idea how much I just spent. It's also very difficult to even find what it was I ordered, especially if I ordered more than one of an item. Better search results would also be great. Show me what I asked for first, and then other similar items, not a randomly jumbled up mix of what I asked for and a bunch of other stuff!

I have found with the vision issues I have developed for the last year or so. It has been becoming harder to read and see the print is to light. It would be nice if you incorporated a dark mode where black background and white print I find easier to read. Plus those with dyslexia also do better with dark mode for which I do have and has been acting up as well plus it would be nice if you also incorporate the ability To Adjust text size and style along with text to speech.

This app was previously functional on all of my Android devices. One of the updates is rendered this app completely unusable on every device I have. The app claims there's no internet connection when I've tried on multiple different methods. There are no useful support threads and Amazon just says to reinstall the app from the play store. An unfortunate experience when the website runs perfectly fine in mobile on all of the same devices.

The latest update is horrible. I shop on Amazon because I have a wider range of product styles/colors/better quality for what I need/want at reasonable prices instead of having to settle for what's available at the local store and cost twice as much. The design before this latest update was perfect and user friendly, but now, it is just awful.

I honestly hate the new UI. much preferred the older style. I don't like the menus being on the bottom and the entire thing is repetitive in where the menus and buttons go. It's too cluttered with idiotic offers in the main section and then has menu buttons that feel like an eight year old with a crayon put them there. Makes looking for anything a chore. I can't hit search fast enough to just get away from that home screen.

To start off, I'm rating the App, not Amazon as a whole. The team responsible for this app has increasingly made poor design choices making it more and more difficult to navigate as time goes on. And rather than sticking with a layout that works, they constantly move stuff that is fine where it's at. Stuff like current orders should have a shortcut on the main screen. It's very unintuitive to have to click something at the bottom of my screen then have to adjust my hands because to reach the top

HATE new update. Use this daily and new update put a bar across bottom of the screen with "helpful" icons which take up WAY too much of the screen. Also, apparently, removed the ability to change the view to the line item view so now all I get is big pictures. Spent 26 minutes, got six different people in customer service trying to get an answer on how to fix this - best they could come up with was to reinstall it which I did and it still has the same issues. Absolutely horrible!!!

I mean, it's the Amazon app. If you Amazon, you will almost certainly App this. I have an issue where any link to an Amazon product page "opens" the app, but all I get is a small header bar saying "Amazon [something]" in black text on a thin white bar across the top of the app screen space, and it hangs. I have to force-close this app, then launch it and wait for it to connect and stabilize, then go back to the offending link which now works.

The app had become progressively slower with recent updates, but still usable. The Oct 6th update however has now made it almost impossible to use. Scrolling and navigating through menus and pages is a struggle, with pages sometimes even freezing altogether. I thought it was just my 3 year old phone struggling, but even a much newer phone with a much more powerful Snapdragon 765G chipset is struggling. Going back to the website for now as I can barely use the app anymore.

Persevered with the update but had to uninstall. Search function is very selective based on what Amazon wants you to buy and not your actual search query. Keyboard covers text in chat. Notifications don't display; selecting "more information" just takes you to the list of orders, not the detail of the message. Simple operations that were straightforward now have to be hunted for and then don't work. Awful app - now having to use browser and reconsidering purchases from Amazon.

The app used to be lightspeeed fast... After a year of interface redesigns and updates, it's probably one of the most sluggish apps I've ever seen out there. Full size photos in product reviews take forever to load... After few failed attempts, I don't even try clicking on video reviews anymore -- I simply don't have 5 extra minutes to wait for each 30 sec video to loadü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è It keep crashing constantly, clicking on product links shows "oops, something went wrong puppy" in like 50% cases..

Used to be the best and still is as far as getting things delivered quickly. However it also used to be the cheapest. I promise you it is now ALWAYS at least $3 to $5 even $10 more PER ITEM than any other place I check. I HAVE CHECKED for multiple items. It's ridiculous. They have gone too far. Must be getting to their heads. Over priced. NOT WORTH IT. SO LAME.

Stop changing the layout of the app and now you have made it nearly impossible for me to return items that either didn't work or weren't as described. I have been super disappointed with Amazon these last few months, between items never arriving and now trying to do a return. The fact that the app keeps crashing and pages won't load properly make it all the less appealing.

The most recent update of the AMAZON MUSIC APP removed the ability to PURCHASE music!! It switches you to the SHOPPING APP, which doesn't show the artist/album/song you want, but other music instead, forcing you to search AGAIN for the artist/album/song. The results UNFORTUNATELY show you EVERYTHING in the store, not just in DIGITAL MUSIC!! SERIOUSLY AMAZON??? FIX THIS!! I WANT TO BUY MUSIC TO SUPPORT THE ARTIST!!

Compared to other Apps this is probably a 4 star app. Compared to previous versions of this app it's 2 stars. The menu selections we're better at the top. It also varies significantly from the desktop browser version where it's easy to find digital purchases. Very difficult to find digital purchase redemption code through the help searches. After checkout and I click to redeem it fails to take me to the redemption code fairly often.

The app works great, makes it all so easy to find what you need. But I am very disappointed with the payment (checkout) procedure since past 3-4days. It just keeps declining. I dnt know if its the payment gateway error or something to do with amazon, but after complaining all I hear is that I might have made a mistake in entering the details. This issue is for Amazon.in

Was very good before the latest update... I used to buy a LOT, and now I just tossed it because it lags. I can't change options on a product page (like colors for example), I click the option and it doesn't switch making it impossible to buy the options I want ... I would need to do it with my computer everytime so I just gave up... Not a bad thing I'm saving money now! ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Your loss Amazon, I saw I'm not alone! You can do better

Keeps reactivating subscriptions. I used to have a subscription for these gloves and I would get them once every 2 months but I canceled the subscription. Notice that it kepted coming in the mail and I had to cancel it again 3 times. I'd even do it with other people assisting me and it would clearly say that it was CANCELLED! and it kept charging me. Otherwise it's a great app.

Since the update beginning of May 2021 the app performance is terrible. Lag times in searches, can't always see past orders and subscriptions. Very often get the 'uh oh something went wrong on our end' message. Revert back to the old one for goodness sake, at least that worked. Edited October 2021 - still issues. Pretty much useless unless you have wifi on, so then what's the point?! Frustrating and annoying. Come on Amazon, put some of your profits into creating a usable app.

Great service! And the tablet I ordered was delivered swiftly, and a day before it was supposed to come in. However, even after an update, the menus and UI on Oreo (8.1) devices such as the LG Stylo 4 are very buggy, sometimes doing rapid flashes. And that might be an issue for many people using Amazon on mobile phones. Please find a way to get this fixed so that the app can actually be used properly.

Default always goes to paying extra for shipping, even when it's not faster. Should be the reverse, default FREE shipping. Also when opening a link from a browser and my S10 options to open in the app, it never loads. You just see a gray bar over the top of the browser page the says Amazon Shopping. Tried restarting, uninstalling, reinstalling, etc.

Amazon is pretty much my go-to for my shopping, there's never much issues with returning or applying for refunds or settling issues between seller and buyer. Prices are competitive, it's just all around convenient. 99% of the time stuff arrives on time and in excellent condition. I love the subscribe and save, you can have regular items delivered without having to shop for them every month or so. I'm a prime customer too so that also includes other perks. I find it worth it for our needs.

The recent update is terrible. The app has never been fast (even with my fast internet) but its gotten slower. It takes a long time for the search results to load etc. Also, whenever I go to check out it freezes up and won't respond even if I let it sit for a while. Free shipping is not set to default and It won't let me select free shipping (who pays for shipping anymore anyway?) Also, it won't complete transactions. Step it up Amazon, it's not like you can't afford an app that actually works.

Ever since the last update, app is mostly useless for shopping. When viewing an item details, app completely freezes after about 20 seconds. You can hit the back button. But then it no longer receives any more data from the internet. So you get a lot of blank pages. You have to close the app and reopen it. But if you go back to viewing an items details, it freezes again. Currently the app is only useful for viewing your account or tracking a shipment. It does not freeze doing those actions.

I'm a prime member and use Amazon almost daily for both personal and business and wouldn't be without it. I held off for many many years as I didn't find them competitive, that's all changed over the last 12 months or so. Anyone thinking of taking the plunge (especially for a Prime Membership) I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Amazon. their returns, speed of delivery and ease of use are unparalleled. Well done Amazonüëç

Our kitties ADORE Greenies Smartbites, and Hairball Control is their favorite. It is now difficult to find. I assume that one of the ingredients is difficult to source or there is some similar problem, because the product certainly sells well! It is now almost impossible to find and my kitties will become seriously depressed when we totally run out! I am glad to have found it here for as long as we have. Thank you!

Please roll back the last update. Can't access departments to filter results or drag product into lists. And the search results only have 10 to15 per page before having to go to a new page, which makes it difficult to skip all the unrelated results that inevitably occur. Are you trying to fix something that was not broken? I will not be shopping with you until this is "fixed ", mainly because I find it terribly annoying. 1year later. I am done. Canceled prime, deleted app. I hope others do also.

This last update has been a pain. Keeps freezing, glitching, can no longer see the different prices on colors/sizes without clicking on each item and option. Used to be great. Because of all the issues, I've spent a couple hundred dollars on other sites because I've been frustrated with Amazon and not willing to restart my searches 30 times to get 1 item.

A shopping app that won't let you shop! I really didn't like the latest update, but today, searching for a book ( both paper and Kindle, as I have done before) I put in the title and author and the results gave me just 4 totally unrelated books. I talked to cust svcs who suggested that I should be searching for Kindle books in another app (ignoring the paper book search I was also trying to do). I am extremely disappointed and will not be buying books from Amazon again as it won't let me!

I use this app often to order online however lately things get stuck in my cart when I try to delete them or save them for later or if I place one in my cart it'll say there's multiple of the same product in my cart and won't decrease. I also don't like that you can't leave a review on a product if you haven't paid for a prime membership. Would love it if people who can't afford a membership were given the ability to leave reviews and ratings as well.

Horrible. This update ruined a great app. It is now useless for casual shopping. I usually buy random things when I see them on sale, well now all those sales are gone. No more 'hey this green one is on sale, I'll get that, instead of looking for the teal one of another brand.' I don't have the time, nor the want, to click on every option for an item to see the price for each one. It is completely useless. Please go back to the old interface.

Terrible update! I can no longer swipe to the right to bring up the menu like 'Orders' and 'Account'. Instead I have to click twice on over-sized icons to check on my orders or cart which is annoying. And now I can't revert to the previous version either - "No longer supported". Please fix this and bring back the 'swipe to the right' function and lose the bottom menu icons which take away screen space or let me revert to the previous working and better version.

As many people do, I absolutely love Amazon! My only problem is that more often than not, after using the app (and sometimes during use) it will freeze on me and I end up having to restart my phone. Otherwise I would give 5 stars. So before you ask, yes my phone has the latest Android version and the app itself is up to date. I've also tried uninstalling and reinstalling it. Still happens. üòü

This last update has made the app look like a badly loaded geocities website from 1999, washed out with oversized and badly aligned text that suggest missing content. The current trend for inverting the layout seems to have caught up here so it's all upside down now. This all wasn't problematic before, it was functional and looked fine (if a little 'pastel-y') To be fair, it all still works fine...it just looks utterly horrendous now. It needs a dark mode at least because it just looks anaemic

I am seeing transactions being removed from my account and added back. Then the transactions declined often. I do not like all the transactions that show up on my bank account. More than once I've called in to ensure that all transactions had a purchase. To me it seems fishy. Something Wish did. Recently the app keeps crashing and I am unable to use it. I deleted it and reinstalled it. Hopefully it will work better. Check your bank statements!

Completely pointless. Every time you go to check out and want to change delivery preferendes you're just left on a loading screen. And I've left it in case it is really loading something and needs to take time, but no a full hour can go by and nothing happens. So I can't use the app to buy stuff, I have to go onto the website instead. Completely defeats the point of having the app.

The new layout is irritating! Nothing is more useful than the previous format and the new app icon is unattractive. The original one was distinctive. I'm already finding myself using the app less than I used to because it's not as intuitive as before. Also, it seems like devs make subtle layout changes several times a month. Ever hear of focus groups? Year of them before you toss out another "update" that has your customers wasting time looking for buttons or functions that were moved.

If you want to buy something you have already/ text searched for or that Amazon suggests it's great. If however you want to browse by category there is no option anymore. Scroll all the way to the bottom for 'all categories/depts/ it just takes you back up to the top of almo st an identical page, no way to pick, books, clothes, pet products, hardware, just loads of things you've probably already looked at, but no easy way to just shop without an algorithm directing you.

Laggy and weird. Where the back button will take you is anybody's guess. "Sort" is so full of sponsored items you might as well not even bother. Also don't bother setting your default payment. Your default is the first one you add no matter what you set it as. Would be nice if the richest company in the world would hire developers who could figure out how to run all the Amazon features from one app so I didn't have to load my phone up with multiples.

Okay, y'all need to STOP messing w this app. It was 100% GREAT before. It worked, was easy to get to your different places, it loaded quick... BUT NOW you people keep fudging with it & it's annoying to find stuff. This is over here, that is now over there in an extremeply inconvenient spot. Things don't load correctly, the layout is horrible. Leave it alone, only thing that should be changed at all is this hideous app face y'all picked for some reason.

I absolutely loved the Amazon App PRIOR to this last update. Since the update, the app is NOT at all user friendly. My Amazon Account is basically inaccessible- as it is very time consuming to load, and once loaded the order history doesnt show complete info. The chat feature in the Customer Service option is ridiculous. Cannot get an actual person, erases messages you have sent, and continuosly sends a message stating " getting help" but never connects to someone.

Last couple of updates have really got me frustrated most of the time. When I went to look at "used" for items I want to purchase it never showed me more than one when it was posted there were four. If I hold my finger on it the whole time while scrolling I can catch a glimpse of the second one. I also had problems just finding the "search" space. This recent update I do NOT care for. My connections are good. I seem to get a lot of animals telling me "oops! Something went wrong, try again"

App constantly freezes and pics won't load. I'm using a new Samsung Galaxy S21+ . All other apps work fine. Home page content isn't consistent or relevant. Frequent programs shows programs I've never used! Deals constantly refresh and you lose your place when browsing. When shopping after style ratings, most items are currently unavailable. I buy most household items and toiletries through Prime. Lately I just get frustrated when shopping and give up. Also, too many scam sellers.

Terrible since the last update.
