The interface now has fixed controls at the top and bottom of the screen instead of a menu that can be hidden when not in use, the app is has many glitches now and I have to exit and reopen just for it to refresh my orders and basket. I no longer get delivery notifications, so I have to hope the parcel is delivered on the intended day rather than having confirmation. The driver location now doesn't update until after the estimated delivery window closes.

I have used the app for years and loved the new features that were added and how everything worked. I even loved how we can now see a map of how many more stops the package has before the final place. With this latest UI change it has become a lot harder to view what I want. Before it was one click to see past orders and now it is several. I got lost when first using the app after the update and wish I could go back to the old layout.

I am happy with the support, the ads, the search engine. It does what it meant to in general. So why 3 stars you may think. Ever since UK has gone out of EU ee have amazon.de to order, and that is all fine. But there is no option to have the description in English for ua that don't speak German but ordering from there is the closest option inside EU. This has been a big drawback for me the last months, while thinking that I see the same items in amazon.uk in English. We need language option.

This app gets worse and worse. There are dumb bugs where you can't easily scroll. Even the items are trash, it's 30 listing of the same 4 different items all with different names. Then it lists 2 day shipping, and they genuinely mean they will start the shipping process in two days not delivery. When you sort by price they actually take items out of the list and add different ones. Just overall terrible, new age walmart only shop here because I have to save a few dollars on a few things.

It if ain't broke, don't fix it, an age old saying, one amazon apparently has never heard. The old app was garbage enough, but the new one takes even longer to get the the features I use. It's not like there's many alternatives, but it sure makes me less inclined to use it very often. If amazon wants to shake things up, at least add a setting to switch it back.

I've been having 2 major issues with Amazon. First, they take payments multiple times, refund them, and then take them again, throwing my whole bank account out of wack. This has put me in a bad situation multiple times, most recently I paid $117 for an item, only for Amazon to give it back without notification, and then take it out again but charging me $3 more on the second withdraw...causing me to go over my credit card limit by $2. Thanks Amazon, now I'll have to pay a $45 over limit fee.

New update sucks. Amazon was fine before this update. Not only was I spending daily , I was so happy with Amazon prime. Being able to access on my mobile app. Now it keeps saying I need to enter my info then it says it's sending a notification and doesn't even connect. I'm not sure if you are hacking me or what. I'm done with Amazon for now. Send me an email when you go back to the old interface.

Amazon Engineers ruined the app. The app worked fine before, the UI was fluent and it was fast. I am using a Note 20 Ultra, the new recent update has turned the app into a cumbersome clunky experience with major latency issues. I've spent over 21 grand this year via Amazon and I'll be using another service until this is fixed. It's too aggravating! Stop trying to fix what isn't broken. Is each engineer trying to impress their boss with each new update? The old version was perfect!

Stopped working after most recent update. All links dump you back on the start page. You literally can't open the page for any item. I order from Amazon several items every week, because I live in the country and don't drive. Other than groceries once a month, everything I buy, I buy from Amazon, and I'm unable to use the app for this as of today. Your loss.

When it works, it's good, but only slightly better than just using the website. However, the app crashes a lot. I can normally look at an item page for 3 seconds before I get a picture of a dog and the words "Uh oh - Something went wrong" This has been the case for months and months. I find it easier to visit the website in my browser, but doing that will often mean the app tries to start up... It's a pain.

No, no, NO! Stop. Every time there's an update, you mess about with the wishlist settings. Why?! Stop fixing what isn't broken. I can now no longer go to my Kindle Wishlist and see at a glance the release dates, what's already been released, and what's available on Kindle Unlimited. I have to tap on every single item and go to that item's page to check. It's a waste of time and a huge step backwards. You also broke the "sort by" function again. Sort by price does not, in fact, do what it ought.

It's no longer great! No longer functional the way it should. If you browes your history and tap back to the list it puts you back to the beginning all the time! The easy to select drop down list is gone! And replaced with icons that make no sense! There's not a single thing works as it did before the update! It's very upsetting!

The app was once nice to use. Aesthetically updates have encumbered the ease to use by burying buttons. Very recent update to orders screen has made it unorganized and the filters do not work great anymore, nor is the status of order displayed consistently or often at all, let alone reliable information. Next update should reverse recent mistakes in user friendly layout and displays, or at least allow customization to be automatic.... along with an educational class on navigating the app. Sad.

Amazon changed the interface and I hate it. The shopping cart and menu is on the bottom now which is inconsistent from the website. This is already annoying because I use my laptop and my phone to purchase things. It is also frustrating because my fingers are moving up and down all the time now. I have to go down to press the shopping cart or menu and then I have to go back up to press the purchase button or the my orders button. I've deleted the app and I'm using the website on both device

Normally, the app works fine, however I am unable to log into the app at the moment. Keep getting error message "This specific device is not authenticated. Please try again. (10)" I can log on fine in my browser so it's not an account problem. I use this app a lot and never experienced problems. Rang customer services and they wasn't much help. Couldn't rectify the problem and just told me to try again in 24hrs! üò†üôÑ

When I download the app, it works just fine on the web-like interface. Then, after a few hours it automatically reverts to an "updated" interface and stops working from there. Plus there is the obnoxious alexa that amazon keep trying to ram down my throat. Tired of uninstalling and reinstalling. My phone is new btw and has 5G. I'm reverting to using the online store version...

Last update has completely ruined the easy to use interface and now forces sponsored items during your searches. Not as easy to use as it was. UPDATE 14/5/21. Now Amazon have taken away the option to search for items pre ordered. Very hard now to see what u have purchased and may need to change. Another reason showing Amazon is not very customer friendly anymore

Very easy to navigate, very smooth interface. I love Amazon! You find everything you're looking for and more. I am an Amazon Prime member so the 2 Day delivery is awesome, never really have a problem with them. The couples times I did have a problem was a package not showing up, and I was either refunded or sent another product, absolutely love the app, so much easier than logging onto the website all the time.

Update 2sep21...my wishlist is still buggy, it lags and jumps as it processes the "inspired by your wish list" recommendations that I disabled weeks ago. I use this app far too often! Aside from the layout changes which i don't like for the same reasons as other reviewers, scrolling thru my wish list is now glitchy...when I try to scroll up it jumps back down, takes several screen swipes to finally work. Also, search results don't show pics for the last 4 items on the page.

New app is a goddamn disaster. Can't change country/language/region so I'm stuck in my neighbouring country in the app. Incredibly slow. New interface is very unintuitive. Something that looks like a menu tab button is actually a junk page filled with random categories. Something that looks like a user settings page is actually a facebook-like profile page. Who even uses that? Huge downgrade, almost unusable. I hope whoever thought this was a good idea got fired.

I'm finding there is very little Amazon does not have availiable to purchase. I have easily over 200 orders in the last several years and have only had one incorrect order. it was still the same brand just different product. having multiple suppliers allows you to shop prices and get the best deal. for the most part shipments are incredibly fast. I love the Amazon app. Amazon also supports small businesses in allowing for easy inclusion on the app to sell their products!

Language Keeps on Switching! I loved shopping in this app but the past weeks I have been so annoyed with the language setting. It was always Eglish but one time I opened it, it was in French. I didn't know where to go lest I press the wrong thing. I was able to find a link online that went straight to the language settings, saved it and thought that was it. Nope.... everytime I open the app it would go back French. I keep on changing it and saving it but the problem repeats itself.

I'm on a Galaxy S7 and the app is terrible. it's incredibly slow and often unresponsive to touch, especially when adding items to a list. I often find myself tapping the screen 20 times just to get something to happen. It's very frustrating, and from what I've read, it seems to be a popular issue. I'm not sure why one of the richest corporations in the world can't fix such simple problems with their major application. Update: Still experiencing these issues on a brand new 5G Motorola.

The redesign is awful. Pictures can't be viewed full screen in landscape without the search box and bottom 4 options covering up 60% of it, zoom doesn't work for some pics, it's even more finicky than it was before, and it's infuriating to navigate. 2 stars bc at least it doesn't look like a web app anymore. But come on, don't push stuff that's broken. Even the symbol that shows which picture you're on has a remnant of old code where it looks like there's a black speck on my screen but it's not.

This would have been at least 4 star review some months back. I don't use Amazon often but when I had in the past I was cool with the service. Now once I type in a search of anything I will maybe(big maybe) get a 1st page result...most of the time I get nothing. Just a white screen with the loading circle of death... eventually a really cute dog pic pops up with the "Whoops something went wrong" "Try again?" I don't want to try again... uninstalling ‚òÆÔ∏è

Keeps changing, becoming less user friendly every time. Search results are all over the place, results very rarely match the search. Appears search results are drastically affected by whatever Amazon is trying to promote as opposed to showing what is actually being searched. Sellers on here are out of control with price gouging, buying up all the stock and doubling or tripling prices. No longer finding good deals on here, unless it's a bootleg version or a fake. Shameful

Amazon starting their service here in the UAE was a godsend. It revitalised online shopping, for me at least. It's a good service, or it feels that way because all others are bad. Thankfully, haven't had a bad experience yet, but I imagine it's a matter of time. Wish their delivery system was a bit more flexible, and allows us to choose the time to receive it. Minus one star.

This update is horrible, slow loading, slow navigation because you unnecessarily moved the button/menu ribbon. I also feel like I lost some of the menu and it feels almost dumbed down and IPhone-esk. At least have the decency to allow the users to select if the button/menu ribbon is at the top or bottom of the screen. I will probably be using the website instead of the app going forward...

Other than some strange advertising algorithms, and the preferential search results, i think the app is really nice. It makes browsing and such much easier for mobile users. I do hope they keep the current setup with the home, profile, cart and menu at the bottom of the screen. That being said it seems a bit redundant to have the a profile and a menu option down there as it seems they do basically the same thing. The menu option seems more efficient to me.

Needs to provide a customer service live chat option more easily. The updated app doesn't provide any customer service help, or chat option. The only way I can access it, is by a lot of searching through the search bar. Which is not user friendly. This needs to be fixed Also, the view orders option doesn't provide a view all option, or multi option in the filters. Which is kind of annoying.

Lost over 200 dollars due to bug. We ordered an item, and it didn't clear it from our cart. In the past this meant it hadn't worked, so we placed our order. After a few days, we noticed the double charge, but were denied cancelling the order. It would cost us 80 dollars to return the item. There was no option to provide feedback in the app about this bug.

New changes with the menu bar at the bottom are awful. Why change something just to change it? Functionality of the app hasn't improved one iota. Amazon, you're focusing on the wrong things to change. Concentrate on the app working correctly first, the look of it second...and put the dang menu bar back at the TOP of the freaking app where it belongs and where it doesn't interfere with phone buttons! Ugh!!!!

Just got a new Pixel and I didn't realize Amazon updated when I opened the app after transferring my data over from my old phone. The layout is different which makes it difficult to navigate especially if you were used to the previous layout. If the app was going to go into this direction with the layout the developers should've updated new changes to the layout little by little over time. It's a big change and a new app logo wasn't going to prepare anyone for this drastic change.

There is an issue with the chat with Customer service in the app. When I start typing the keyboard on your phone overshadows the typing field, so you actually cannot see what you are typing. I have to close the keyboard in order to see/change my text/fix mistakes. Not very convenient. I keep installing and uninstalling the app because of this only so I can chat faster with the Customer support.

They've removed a lot of the clutter to streamline the app, but in doing so, they have also managed to remove entire features. Would you like to browse by department? Sucks for you. Want to search something specific? Sorry, Amazon's search algorithm is still hot, salted garbage. Much functionality available on desktop is either hidden under a maze of unnecessary menus or absent entirely. The app is actively hostile to use.

Love the app! My complaint on it is the speed. No matter how fast your connection it always seems to lag a lot when switching pages. And that's on search results and product variations. I can literally pop open chrome and get what I need done faster than the app. This is on a Stylo 5, it's had the snail syndromen my previous phones as well.

Almost everybody uses this, so I don't have to get into how it works. I came across a problem with my Prime membership, where an option that should be included in regards to shipping was not available. I've tried troubleshooting and seeking help from customer support, but they were just as stumped as I was. Being put on hold up to six times, I have been hung up by three of their representatives in the end with no resolve. I cancelled my Prime membership. No point in paying for broken service.

New update ruined the app! I try to search for items while signed into the app. When I click on an item, it seems I'm on an internet browser window than in the app. It asks me to sign in again! Then it takes me to a page to enable cookies on the browser, WHEN I'M ON THE APP! I cannot get passed this page. What's the point of having an app to avoid the browser if they are the same thing.

Works like a charm! The app is preferable to my computer, due to the fact I can take my time to compare products in my freetime. I feel it helps me to make more informed decisions on my purchances this way. The only thing I would improve so far is the lists option, which when first selected, will go to a blank page. Then one has to click to see the lists. Which does not make sense. But over all, is a very, very good app!

When I search for a specific, name brand item, I get a lot of irrelevant items. Also, when sorting from low to high, for example, a massive number of hits disappear leaving mostly irrelevant item. I wish I could search for an exact phrase while excluding words I do not want. If these small things were added I would rate 5 stars.

App works fine. The quality of products has taken a sharp curve down. Have to return a third of the stuff I buy because it's broken or wrong items. I'm switching to Wal-Mart plus. Same shipping times and at least with that, I won't have to drive 56 miles to return stuff. If you want the products on Amazon, just order it from wish. Half the time you will get it in same time anyway.

it's great that I can find almost anything on Amazon but delivery times have gotten slower and slower in the last few months. Paying for Prime 2-day delivery does not seem to matter any more because some prime items can still take a week or more to arrive. Using USPS was the worst idea Amazon ever came up with. Item selection, on the other hand, is great. it's great being able to find so many things in one place.

When you put all your eggs in one basket..... They have integrated fresh into Amazon shopping. It's confusing when you search and non - fresh items come up. We just want to add to our fresh basket. Some items which are groceries cannot be placed in the fresh shopping cart. Preferred the old Prime now, and Amazon shopping app. It's frustrating to use....

I do a lot of shopping on amazon, but I am having issues with the app since the recent update. It keeps trying to load, and the screen freezes when I try to scroll down. The next and previous buttons also disappear at times so I can't continue to shop for more products. I have a samsung galaxy s7, so it isn't an issue with my phone. Please work out these bugs. It's making it very hard for me to shop.

I can't believe how Amazon can get a simple thing such as clearly displaying the Logout button so wrong! I literally came on to leave this review after spending a few minutes trying to find the Logout button and I still can't find it. This happens every time I switch accounts and for the life of me I can never remember or find it again. What an incredible feat. Please sort this out and make it easier to get to as this is one painful experience.

Amazon fire stick hasn't been working correctly. Disconnects and connects every couple of minutes. Takes half an hour just to try to watch a show or movie & then disconnects. I've tested multiple devices and everything works fine except the Amazon fire stick 1st generation. Seems like amazon may have done something to cause the 1st generation sticks to not function normally. What a waste of money.

I have amazon prime and while that experience is great, the app has become pure garbage. I can't seem to enter the search bar without an annoying bug showing up where a double search bar appears that doesn't let me search anything. The only way to get rid of it is to close the app. It wouldn't be so bad if didnt happened every other time I open the app. EDIT: Why is it that when I try to click on cart, it takes me to the search results and refuses to take me to the cart??! So annoying

Don't have an issue with the app, in fact I use it more than the web site. However, when it asks me how the delivery was, I need an option to say the driver can't read a map & just followed your GPS down a lane next to my house, parked up for a few mins then gave up saying it couldn't be delivered (I can see them on the map and out of the window). 2 days in a row! In the past I've had parcels returned undeliverable as 'damaged' after the the driver did the same thing. Prime is not worth it.

Why would you try to 'fix' something that's not broken? The "Orders" tab was previously so accessible - to access the products that had been ordered. With the new UI, it's buried at the bottom of a menu with a ton of other things, under another sub heading called "Your Stuff". Way too many keystrokes + gestures to access such fundamental/accessed information. It got me so frustrated (built up over the course of the past several times I used the app), that I felt obligated to rant about it.

I was always very pleased with Amazon prime shipping quality, after all it is not free, you have to pay for subscription. Very useful if you needed anything next day (otherwise you would go shopping and buy the same product somewhat else or order on ebay). Unfortunately, recently everything changed and delivery are always late, next day or few days later. Unfair with customers, because after all subscription is a kind of agreement. We are paying- you delivering. It happened too many times!

The new layout SUCKS. Every time I think the app layout can't get any worse, someone at Amazon tries to out do their last layout fiasco. Not user friendly at all. Amazon, please, go back to how it was where I could actually navigate your app. Oh, and if I'm checking orders and I go back to the order page, it goes all the way back up so I have to scroll back down to find the next order. Awful.

Just STOP changing the look of this app already! Everytime it's changed it gets worse!! The new design with the task bar at the bottom of screen is TERRIBLE. Stop messing with stuff that isn't broken! At the very least give customers the option to MOVE the bar to the TOP of the screen....this is why I try to not update apps. A perfectly fine app is always butchered with a "new UI"...

I rarely have issues and if I do? Amazon comes to my rescue every single time!! Thank You!! UPDATE: I too don't like new layout. It's hard enough for some of us senior citizens, but the new layout is just plain frustrating and has taken alot of the enjoyment i used to feel when browsing the Amazon halls and walls for something fun to purchase. Please put it back the way it was!!!!!

App was great before the latest update. Not sure what made the developers decide to make changes because it was fine before. Been having issues with scrolling/selecting through item pictures. Eg. When there is multiple colors of the same item and you click it the item changes but the picture is faded out as if the item was out of stock but its not out of stock if that makes sense.

New reworked app has a lot of issues compared to tried and true previous app. First covers up the Android controls at the bottom of the screen on some phones. Second it is slower than the previous app period and third it is more cumbersome and difficult to navigate than the previous app. I have seen no advantages and several disadvantages to the new app over the old.

The recent updates to both the app and website is dreadful. The search function no longer functions correctly as Amazon will show you items not remotely related to what you're searching for. Even when it rarely does, they've included so much advertising with the search results that it becomes nearly impossible to find what you're looking for. Edit 12/26/2021: This app is a bit better, but still lacks big-time. It's hugely inconvenient that I cannot search review keywords in the Amazon app but can on their website. I like the app and most features. Great customer support!! Some of the products are becoming shoddy but returns are easy enough. I do really dislike the search feature. I love Amazon it is my go to for online shopping. The membership is Great if you are on EBT your membership fee is reduced. The app tends to lag a little bit nothing unbearable. The previous menu interface was a lot better- less confusion and more overlapping of how to get where I want to be (order history, purchase history, categories etc). Slooow. Doesnt work most of the time. Freezes up my phone. No better than shopping on the web app (actually worse b/c it's so slow). Other annoying little things like the filter window disappearing with each filter that I choose. Let me choose all the filters then hit done. The delivery notifications are nice for watching for packages.

Keeps Crashing OnePlus 7 Pro, forcing me to restart my phone. In those instances, the order tracking screen overlays itself permanently over the home screen of the phone. Even force closing the app does not get rid of it. This means the only user interaction possible still is via the hardware buttons and the notification drawer and settings of the phone. This is with fully updated apps, OS, stock rom and launcher. This problem exists since January and has not yet been fixed in March.

The orders page changes every few months. Why? This is dumb! I like it when current/open/unshipped orders are at the top regress of when the order was placed. The option to filter only open orders doesn't exist anymore (even on a browser). Now to find my open orders I have to scroll through months worth of purchases? (I pre-order books, often months in advance.) Seriously!? This is ridiculous! If I could choose how the orders page is sorted that'd at least be something.

I absolutely hate how the app will leave my search if I have to put my phone down for 5 minutes, when I've already been browsing for a few pages. I also hate that there is no way to set default settings for a search. I ALWAYS want to set it to prime shipping, and I have to do this manually every time. The search functionality is garbage, too. I get irrelevant results on the first page.

I was forced to update this app, and nw every time I use my lists the app freezes and I have to kill it. Interacting with a list in any way kills the app 100% of the time. Drop down menus either don't work or lock up the app. Web links to Amazon put a gray banner across the top of my screen but don't let me view products. If I'm not quick at closing the app when it lags, it makes my flagship Note 10+ completely unresponsive. I want my old app back, this is trash.

Who doesn't love Amazon! Although I am beginning to see a lot of fake products. For example, you have to really search to find the original legitimate Bare Minerals make up. All the other product says that the it is and has Bare Minerals on it. Please know it's completely fake and almost are just as expensive. I do wish that they could try to control that little bit better and maybe offer a few discounts like eBay does. Be able to bid things off. Have auctions i

I downloaded to take advantage of a promotional offer, placed my order, promotion not applied, customer service said promotion was expired, nothing they can do. Message box hidden when contacting cust service makes difficult to see what you are typing. I placed one order and app worked fine. There were no issues with using the app and seemed easy enough to navigate.

There's honestly no reason to pay for Prime to get faster shipping. I can't begin to tell you how many orders have been late, even before covid. There's no such thing as 2-day delivery when it's three days late. It's hardly ever on time, even when it's coming from a warehouse in the same city! I can't set my account on the app for Amazon Smile. I can on my phone but not the app on my tablet. Settings> no Amazon Smile option unless notifications are turned on.

it advertises to me to save some money by purchasing addons items. so I try to get an order over 25 bucks or to utilize this, and either the addons item suddenly goes out of stock, or one of the other items in the list. you cant purchase addons items seperately, unless you use subscribe and save. So if you manage to get an addons item, it will likely ship in a separate parcel and get lost in delivery or returned to the carrier. convenient app for sure, but support local when possible people!

The new update is AWFUL. I have never had a problem with the Amazon app until this update. It keeps locking up, crashing, and taking forever for pages to load. I have to keep uninstalling and reinstalling. My phone is only a few months old and I have plenty of storage space. This is the only app I have issues with. Seems like with all the billions of dollars you are making off the plandemic, you could find some decent software engineers.

App seems to crash everytime you view wishlists. Works fine on web browser but the updates on the app have made shopping on amazon really difficult. Randomly adding things to shopping basket and constant crashing. Have to shut the app down after viewing an item so constantly closing app just to browse. Wish lists don't work anymore. Also noticed the web version on a computer is doing the same thing. Purchasing on here used to be streamline, now it's just a hassle.

Recent updates have eliminated the ability to track orders on a live map. I still get the notification saying " see where your package is on a map". Tapping it opens the correct page with a map frame, but the frame is empty then disappears after a couple seconds. With the holidays coming up and all the Porch Pirates out there this is going to cause losses for Amazon. Living in an apartment building makes this worse. I prefer shopping Amazon but not if I can't track stuff especially holiday stuff

Obviously something is wrong with new layout freezing my phone and draining battery. I know you weren't very profitable ten years ago. Now your rich...get your S together, the app freezes on up while all the rest run fine. My phone is moto g7 power, your app is garbage now. It still looks ok, messages belong with notifications...your app should show things when opened, icon counter style for delivery, sale, and notices. It would be nice to have save for later to multiple lists like grocery.

All your Amazon needs in one place. To clustered, making it hard to find items you need to purchase. Searching items can be difficult. Shopping for food items are difficult also. Sales prices are medium, not the best compared to other Supermarkets. I think I will go in and visit the whole Foods next time.

For the last few months, not matter what time of day or night I've tried to shop on Amazon via the app, IT KEEPS CRASHING!! I'll be smack in the middle of searching for or looking at an item's page or even in the middle of a transaction &this keeps crashing!! I've let customer service know because I needed help with ordering stuff so it would arrive by the time I needed it, but I don't remember if I had e-mailed the dev team more recently besides in July possibly. This has gone on sporadically.

Overall this app isn't bad. The search results can be very limited at times compared to the results in the Chrome web browser. Chrome delivers more results. After the last update, the Amazon shopping app won't let you go back to your search results after viewing an item. Hitting the back button or symbol causes a closure of the app.

Hate the new update - the viewing is no user friendly. I have a grid style result now instead of a list, it doesn't show me the full name of the item and more importantly it doesnt show customer ratings, which practically governs which item I select. It's unusable this layout for me. Cannot find a "list view" button it's stuck in grid view. I'm so cross I cannot use Amazon anymore and have been a Prime customer for over 10 years , have a basket of ¬£200 which I won't buy now.

The latest update to this app is awful. It shows my name and information, but if I want view orders or anything else it prompts me to log in. When I try to log in it tells me to enable cookies on my web browser. First of all, cookies are enabled. Second, what do my browser settings have to do with the functions of the separate Amazon shopping app? This is ridiculous and makes me not want to use the app at all. This update tried to "fix" something that wasn't broken. I want my working app back.

Over all great and adheres to my needs as I shop with it nearly everyday HOWEVER I find it very interesting yet very f***** up that when you try to change the payment method at checkout or select free shipping (that should already be selected by default if I qualify) it gives you a plethora of technical issues including a gray snowy screen, and freezing. But it has absolutely no issue with the PLACE ORDER button ü§î P.S. I updated today (4/3/21)

What happened? The app is glitching a lot. When I click on a product the screen does not show me the title or number of stars. They just disappear. Those are the first two things I always look at. Then when I try to choose an option for the product, it takes forever to load. I uninstalled and reinstalled the app, still same issue. Thought it might be my screen protector so I removed it. Still same issue. Not gonna lie, these issues have resulted in me purchasing less than usual.

It's slow AF! When they redesigned it, it made the speedy process slow AF, and those delays of making the next screen is horrendous! Whoever came up with all that loading time in the programming needs not only more training, but their *ss whooped! It still works, don't get me wrong, but that's why the 2 star drop, the speed vs the old way.

Had an older version of the app as bloatware on my phone. Now Amazon has a new one, instead of updating/directly replacing the old one, making it so that I have several dozen gigabytes of useless, inaccessible memory. Thank you for your consideration, corporate overlords. Very kind.

New logo looks like a brown bag a wine'o would use, or a barf bag on a plane. It definitely doesn't evoke the quality of Amazon. 08-04-2020 Review Sometimes the improvements make it harder to shop. For instance, when I want to filter my view, the app automatically takes me out of the filter view each time I make a change. The eBay app let's me set all the view filters at one time and gives me a "DONE" button to click when I'm finished. Just my 2¬¢.

I like Prime and use it a lot, but this app drove me nuts! Like others have said, the design is all off. The design team needs to be called in and shown all of these comments. Way too in-your-face bright and carnival-y to be a comfortable shopping experience. Yes, sites have to change over time, but not like this. I'll come back when you've figured it out.

PLEASE!! Stop ‚úã moving your app's storage location from SD card back to internal storage. This application is barely a thing. Two words can describe it: "very poor". Sometimes slow; sometimes taking forever; little accessible functionality; no accessible configuration; visually unappealing and dull; low resolution graphics; eating mobile data. It's like a poorly made blank application. I have zero reasons for recommending it. I am longing for it to improve!

I like the item comparison charts and the easy opportunity to see other choices that are similar to what I'm considering. The Q&A section can be very helpful. When I look over the reviews, I strongly rely on the Values Listings. I do have to be wise about the pricing. There have been times when I've found the same product sold cheaper, for example on the brand name's homepage. I regularly shop for specialty items from Whole Foods or Amazon Fresh. When the price is right, I LOVE that convenience!

A BIG prob I've noticed recently has happened when I've tried to chg my choice of some of the products to see how they look. Sometimes, altho the descriptions state that the choices R "in stock," the resulting photos of the product in the color (or other chg) I want to view are grayed out &I'm unable to scroll the photos. Oh, there's 1 other occasional prob I've noticed since the last update. At times an entire page has a HUGE prob scrolling down & "flickers" if U try &U hv to force it down :/

The app is getting worse, not better. You have to click so many times to see what was on the home screen before. The app is slower. Viewing past orders is more complicated, and when you try to see what you bought the app either throws an error or just goes back to the home screen (forcing you to start all over). And to mention waaayyy too many sponsored items showing first for almost a whole page, horrible for a company who already make too much profit off of their employees backs.

Annoying UI design created to maximize clicking and increase browsing time. Examples: 1. It is ridiculous to get a smaller number of results when you sort by price low to high, vs. high to low. 2. No back/return arrow if you use a phone with swipe enabled navigation. So if you swipe left, the app will completely exit your search, and bring you to the home page. You cannot return to your search. 3. Printing. It is 2021 and the app redirects you to a BROWSER sign in to print labels.

App is garbage. It's just a app version of their mobile site and functionality pretty is limited. I'm sure it was developed just so big AZ can get better metrics on your shoppin/usage habits. Functionality is also very limited, you can't search reviews for keywords, Amazon links constantly don't load, just overlays the app in the previous app it was linked in a dead screen, search and viewed history doesn't work and makes no sense, it's really hard to find certain settings and features, etc etc.

Memory hog. Ive tried downloading it a couple of times, but I erase it every time bc it's disrupts my smartphone use because everything goes slower aftwerward. The damn app is ALWAYS open in the background, too -- likely listening to me, or tracking me, to sell me more things. Amazon, our new overlord. Thanks to you massive consumers out there! Sigh....

new features suck. If you search a term specifically, say a tv show with a big fanbase, results will be filterable by media categories only, and the prime shipping filter button on top disappears. Whomever decided this change to the search criteria was brilliant needs to be demoted. You've eliminated easily searchable items on your mobile platform by limiting yourself. no better than walmart now. edit: now included is useless spelling auto correct. very specific items will now be lost to you

A recent update makes the chat feature incredibly frustrating to use because you can't see what you're typing unless you minimize the keyboard and then you have no way of editing because as soon as the keyboard comes back up, you can't see the chat box. It's so annoying I'm about to uninstall because I can't use customer service chat without it opening the app. Hopefully this review will do something to get it fixed.

App will not bring up any products after selection. When i tap on an item to see the full description it glitches out and brings me back to the app home page. I've tried this with multiple items with none of them being related. I literally cannot even attempt to buy anything or see anything concerning the items i am interested in. Please fix as soon as possible so i can update my review and change it for the better. Usually it's extremely simple to navigate and find what I'm looking for.

To restrictive, slow and annoying at times. For specific items it ok. But I would prefer to use the full app and not be taken here all the time, therefore I'm un-installing for now. New app interface is horrible. I don't know who thought it was a good idea! It makes it miserable to use the app now. Unless they change it back to the classic layout, I'm forced to delete this awful new version! CHANGE IT BACK AMAZON! We pay you too much, to make our buying experience complicated!

Sorting and filtering is a farce. Default sort by featured is the only sorting method with relevant results. Try sorting by lowest to highest and all relevant results literally disappear. Try comparing sorting methods on an item you know has only enough listings to be on one page and you'll see. So now what? You have to manually browse allll the featured results to find the lowest priced item. Page. By. Page. The longer they have your attention the more likely you are to buy some trash they push

New app layout Please go back to the previous layout, now that you have put the menu buttons at the bottom of the page it interferes with Samsung phones, our screens are touch screens and we use the bottom of the screen to go back, close and shut down apps, some of the swipe actions are also done from the bottom of the screen. So therefore we end up shutting the app down when we are trying to explore the app.

the "auto-renew on/off" and the "advanced controls" links, used to cancel prime channels in "manage subscription", are no longer listed in the list of prime channels. i had to call amazon to cancel auto-renew. they are constantly making changes to the moving the subscription menu to the extent i suspect amazon is purposely doing this as an impediment to force the customers to keep the channels out of frustration for having to figure out their ever changing access to managing subscriptions.

I used to like and buy a lot using the app, but since the last update is nearly impossible to utilize it! It's slow and it keeps logging me out every minute!! It's quite annoying! I can't do anything, because every time the log in page appears again and again, doesn't matter how many times I do it, it keeps asking the information again. And the new logo is terrible!

Can't view my order history. I've been using Amazon since 2006 and according to the app, I've never purchased anything. Way to drop the ball, Amazon. Update(2/26/21: Performing a search on the app automatically assigns a product category to the results. This is a huge inconvenience AND I can't remove the category. üò§ Update(4/9/21): Category is still automatically assigned to my results AND now I can't find/search for a nearby Amazon Locker?! Please hire a new app development team.

Honestly this app is kind of a mess. It's got a lot of nifty features (barcode lookup, AR clothing... etc.) but it's bloated, slow, and clearly has a memory leak because it gets progressively laggier the longer you use it. Bizarre requirement to turn on ALL notifications if you want to order through Amazon Smile. There's potential but as it stands this is a downgrade from just using the website, even on mobile.

The Last 2 AMAZON APP updates performance wise are horribly bad! Laggy isn't a good enough adjective to properly describe the screen freezes, the unresponsiveness of this app! I mean my wife and I can't even swipe through pictures of a product on both of our phones without it just staying Frozen, until it eventually moves on its own! Both of our phones have the App updated and our phones act exactly the same with this app!So it is clearly the messed-up software of this app! Need New Developer's!

New icon w/ this update is a step down in appealing design. I get it's to look like an Amazon cardboard box, but the ugly brown isn't appealing at all. And I'm frequently getting a blank white screen when I open the app or try to open a product page, not even an error message. And when I type in the "Have a question?" bar then scroll uptdown and try to click on something else, it bounces me right back to the have a question part. I have to back out of product page then go back.

When you select music category from the top of the home screen it tries to get you to sign up for Music Unlimited. There is no way to close this offer screen, so there is no way to browse music. This is asinine. Especially as the music app no longer lets you shop for music within the app. Not having a way to provide feedback within the app is also poorly designed.

I cant use Amazon anymore. The apps navigation is somehow getting worse, and the notifications on items with a lower price are completely random and annoying. There is no notification setting that describes that specific alert and I do not care that a shoe I have never even looked at or ever want to is $10 cheaper. There's no quality control within the marketplace itself and everything I buy is a fake or not worth the money. I'll wait longer for shipping for quality items and buy elsewhere.

Consistent shipping delays and app error issues along with customer service being very unhelpful. I pay money for two day shipping, gets told it will be 3 to 5 business days instead. And then 10 days later hopefully my packages show up. On top of that, the app won't even display the order, let alone allow me to track it. I understand that sometimes stuff happens, but with the consistency it's been happening can only result from gross negligence and shotty workmanship.

My app on my Samsung Note 20 stopped working a couple days ago. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling, but it didn't help. The app opens, but all I get is the picture of the dog saying "oops, something went wrong." And a "Go Home" button. If ai click the "Go Home" button, I also get the picture of the dog and "Oops.... Something went wrong." I have not added any recent apps or changed any settings on my phone at all. The Amazon Shopping app on my phone is totally unusable and worthless.

Since 10/23 the shopping app is having A LOT of problems.. freezing, lagging, reloading old items just stop functioning intermittently after a few minutes of seamlessly working. I'm constantly having to restart my phone because it just freezes. I've tried changing connection from WiFi to Mobile Data while on the app and it doesn't make a difference. Hope the developer can issue an update or fix soon because I do a lot of shopping through this app. Never had a problem until now.

I used to like it a lot. I had to change phones to something that worked better in rural areas (Galaxy S7 Edge), and Amazon Shopping no longer works on that Android OS version at all. Too old or something. That surprised me! Anyway, I downloaded Walmart and NewEgg to try. They seem to work fine. So, I guess it's no big.

Great app, easy to use. Always handy to buy last minute items and is immeasurably helpful for uni books!! One gripe I have; I signed up to Amazon Smile ages ago, and was chuffed when I saw it was usable in the app as well as browser. Just tried to activate it on a new phone and had a pop-up saying notifications have to be turned on to do this. Really? To be able to support a charity when using the app (regularly!) I HAVE to have bothersome notifications about sales etc?? Disappointing üòû

There is absolutely no benefit to having this app on your phone when the mobile website is so much better in every aspect. The UI of the app is purposefully terrible. Every single section, from your order history, to support, to selfhelp options, are designed to spam you stuff to buy. And that's just one problem out of a dozen more. To put it briefly: be kind to yourself and use the mobile website.

The app is bugging out. It's unresponsive to touch for about 3 to 5 seconds, it's laggy and when I look at a product most of the time it just straight up freeze. This is not good for a app that you use to buy stuff online it can cause accidental or wrong purchases. Cleared cache and data uninstalled and reinstalled it still same thing. Have to order stuff off my computer

Though having Amazon at ones fingertips seems like a brilliant idea on paper, the app itself is so slow, laggy, and generally indecisive on if it wants to work at all the shopping app is a shame to the Amazon name. I was having flashbacks to surfing the net in the mid 90s with how unresponsive and torturously slow-reacting the menus were trying to order a singular item.

I have absolutely hated using Amazon with its current app updates. When I click a particular item to view it the top portion of the screen disappears and I'm unable to see the item description or the reviews up at the top. When I scroll down and then try to browse different color or size options, they all disappear and I need to resort to clicking through them one at a time. I have used the app multiple times looking to make purchases and have ended up closing the app out of utter frustration

The new layout really sucks. Your Orders used to be prominenly displayed right on top of the menu page so you could check the status of the order really quickly. Now it's hidden down in a flyout menu at the very bottom of the page. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the original design, unless that is, you found a way to make Bezos more money while inconveniencing the rest of us..

4 one time passwords (confirmed correct by amazon) 4 times not accepted by the delivery driver. No clear way to cancel items you haven't received yet. Very very poor experience over all. Live chat help that is clearly from a script. What's the point in having security with one time passwords if they aren't working correctly. Pointless and a waste of time.

Shipping is nightmare! Prior to 2021 everything was great. Now? I have ordered 2 different times. Tracking is nonexistent. Doesnt even show where package is. One package is lost. I waited till refund was about to run out to see if maybe it would show. Nope! Now tried to order another item and now it says its delayed again. Won't say where its coming from or anything, just that Amazon is shipping.

easy to use and has nearly everything you will need. could improve on the way you can refine a search, I find eBay is better at searching when you refine it for specifics. but can't complain about amazon's service. maybe it's because I'm a prime customer which makes a big difference in price, otherwise delivery charges would be high. app is good.

I really enjoy shopping on Amazon, however, their app is absolutely horrible!! It takes forever for anything to load and it always resets itself back to the home screen right in the middle of a search... It's incredibly frustrating!!! I do order a lot of items from them but I would probably order quite a bit more if there weren't so many issues with this app. I'm a prime member and I've actually considered cancelling my membership because of this.

Latest update broke app on Android phone. Can hardly shop on this app anymore. Pages freeze when you try to select different product options, such as colors or styles available on single product pages. It also won't let you view photos for the different options unless you navigate to that specific style or color from the main search listing. This is terrible. I'm actually shopping other sites now because it's a burden to try to shop Amazon with these new issues. Been an issue for weeks.

Ever since the update when I go and look at a product and try to switch between different options and colors it freezes up. Sometimes after I switch back and forth between the different colors of the product they will finally load the pictures but that's only if I get lucky. It also won't let me save certain colors of products to my wish list. What's going on? why did you even update something that didn't need fixed????

I use this app on my my S21 Ultra to search & shop for books. I probably order on average at least 10 books a month from you guys. You are a trillion dollar company & you can't even provide your loyal customers with an app that functions properly! For 2 months now I have not been able to scroll through my saved lists without it continuously freezing. I can't even view items I've saved to my lists without it being a huge headache! Already tried reinstalling the app. Doesn't work! Fix it now!

Once again Amazon just can't keep from changing a good thing. STOP moving the items on the app around. ORDERS and items associated need to remain in one place. While the app has improved in speed, functionality -no matter how good it gets - suffers because users keep having to look for options that move around. Msg to developer management: have a user review committe - customers who DONT work for AMAZON.

Recently on startup this app just hangs while it waits for advertising to load that shows a spinning disc if scrolling down the page & won't respond until that's finished. Can't type to search or go to other tabs until it's done whatever it's trying to do. If I clear the storage & cache on the app it's fine again, but next time I use the app it does the same annoying freeze up. Terrible user experience when I know exactly what I want to buy and I have to wait. This happens on both of my devices

Automatically started switching my language preference to French... which a) gave me a heart attack the first time it happened thinking ive been hacked and b) now makes the app almost unusable (not to mention the email spam notifying me about it) because it keeps doing it over and over even after I set my preference to English... a quick google search shows that this is an ongoing problem for multiple people using both the app and the desktop version. Remove this "feature" please.

Very easy to use, browse, and purchase. Nearly anyone can grasp the idea of how to online shop with amazon. On top of that, it has one of the quickest and easiest customer services I've had the pleasure of working with... However, it doesn't have the greatest user interface, at least not on mobile. Reviews and customer pictures are flushed to the bottom of a very lengthy page. There should be a tab you can select to quickly scroll your screen to your desired point of view. 4 Stars!

The links in their Emails re orders and tracking emails do not work, if you click on the link there's a message saying the page doesnt exist, and asks if you want Amazon Home Page. Whats the point in them sending emails with corrupted links! Spoke to Amazon customer services several times but was given the "go away and dont bother me" help. Not helpful, is it!

I've used this app for years with no issues. The last couple of days the app will freeze when I change options at checkout like shipping or payment method & will not let me complete my order or change other options. I called customer service for this tonight & also months ago for an unrelated issue; each time the "help" from both agents AND a manager was worthless & caused more frustration than it is worth. I don't like using my computer for purchases. Pointless to have an app I can't use.

My main annoyance, and it may be small to some but it's happened enough to make me just use Google search instead and use other retailers, is that it will change your search terms when looking for products, thinking they're typing errors I guess, but it leads to completely unrelated results. Pretty poor, I know what I want look for, let me look for it, don't interfere.

Used to work great. Now it glitches, you can't scroll through your wish lists without it sticking or lagging. They should also make it much easier to organize your lists, like being able to select multiple items to move them to a different list instead of having to move one at a time and then having to scroll all the way back to the next item to move over. Needs a MAJOR update ASAP

Every change introduced in the latest update is a deterioration from its predecessor. Controls at bottom of page are less obvious and intuitive and require more button presses/selections to get where you want to go than they did before... and don't get me started on the introduction of giant font sizes when searching. I'd genuinely hoped this was some sort of April fools Day prank, alas I was wrong.

I don't know when, but probably since they changed the logo, but the app almost never loads the first time - just get a blank white screen. If I swipe it away and reload it works fine for a while but then a future launch fail in exactly the same way! After years of rock solid, how could they release such a shonky app and not pull it immediately tjere was a problem. It's been like this for weeks now...

Please go back to the old format. The new update is not user friendly. It is also very glitchy, freezes and flashes when trying to load. The Today's Deals section is horrible to look through. Items do not load properly. I am one that likes to look around on Amazon daily whether it be for a need or a want, but this update makes it unenjoyable. I find myself getting frustrated and just closing the app.

Keeps setting my purchases to gifts. A recent update seems to have screwed up the app. Everything I purchase is automatically set as a gift, even though I have not set it. It shows the gift packaging option for every item and when I go in and deselect GIFT, it ignores it again. Now I have to finalise purchases on my pc. Well done Amazon.

App used to work well. But I'd rather just use Amazon on my phone browser, which works just as well on mobile and easier to switch to desktop version when needed. However, in the last few weeks the app has been switching itself to Spanish. I think it may be because I've started following links to Amazon products, but not sure. Amazon even sends me emails alerting me that "I" have changed my default language, but I haven't. Pain in the butt so I'm going to uninstall until I'm forced to reinstall

Amazon shopping has become a venue for cheap, practically worthless junk products. There was once a time when the majority of items were high quality and that time is long gone. now, 99% of items are cheap Chinese, no name trash can fodder. the only good thing left about Amazon was the prime channel and at this cost, I can get Comcast cable with EVERY add on available which has made THIS service also a worthless ripoff.

For God's sake if you want to put a map to show the parcel make it big enough to see. Loaf of rubbish. So try tracking your parcel using the updated app. Can I say it's worse than useless! You think you have a chance but no way. It was bad enough before the update but the window close X is over the enlarge X and no prizes for guessing which one activates first. Won't be using it in future so can't recommend it.

The latest update made it so that when I go to the orders page I see my incoming packages intermixed with stuff that has already been delivered. This is really annoying. In the past I was able to click on the orders button and see a list of incoming packages all at the top so that I could quickly see when they are all arriving and delivered stuff at the bottom. Please rollback to this.

The search option is terrible. I search for one thing and it shows me loads of irrelevant stuff. I can't narrow it down. Half the time the price filter isn't there. Sometimes the departments I want are missing. I can't filter by colour, size or other specific criteria. Amazon needs to learn from Ebay. Their search engine is a million times better.

I've been actively using Amazon since my Multiple Sclerosis has made everything super limited. They're usually always early, most products I buy are to help me do some kind of normal task, that's just gotten a bit more challenging so im adapting to new processes. Like smart bulbs, and outlets, controlled by voice, and my phone. Xbox, tv, phones, lights, and spikes for my braces so I avoid extra help falling. I love Amazon. Only issue, ever, is the language barrier, that's cost me extra money.

UI issue in recent versions: the top navigation banner is a gray void of empty space. I can still get to search and departments by blindly tapping on parts of that gray void so its just a graphical error, but this isn't acceptable. Reinstalling with cache clearing doesn't help and I have no idea how to properly report this (neither did the customer care reps at first before giving me a general contact email). A major update later and the problem is WORSE (from intermittent to constant). LG V20

good shopping app for anyone looking to get a convenient shopping experience right from their phone, tablet or other device! Amazon offers cool things like Amazon gift card services, shipping to other people though I don't think it is available in all states or to all states yet. Amazing app with no glitches or issues. Really makes for a much smoother experience, where I'm at the internet signal is pretty good and this makes it a lot easier when the pages don't crash. Ease of shopping/navigation

For some reason, every time I'm trying to scroll through pictures or products horizontally, the app wants to move the page vertically up and down. Every other app when I scroll through content horizontally, the page does not twitch vertically up and down. Everything else is just fine, it's just the display will not stay stable.

They lose my orders .. and if they don't lose them, they deliver them to my neighbors. Upgraded to prime hoping that would make a difference but nope. Still haven't gotten what I've been trying to order for three weeks now. Amazon used to be amazing but now amazon sucks. And I'm not the only one seeing it, my friends have lost many packages lately as well. About to boycott Amazon cuz they haven't done much right for me since I started using it again.

The search filters have not been working at all. It always shows prices outside the ranges selected, and when I sort by price Low to High some of the most expensive ones are at the top, because they seem to have been shuffled at random. Along with other UI inconveniences, it makes the app not worth using. And there's no way in-app to file a bug report.

Are you kidding me with this? Like many others, I have spent an obscene amount of money with Amazon and the thanks we get is a shite app update? The original was fine and functional. I've had 'oops, theres an error' all day. Mobile site works just fine. I'm running out of reasons to stay. Fast and free shipping was the big draw, but with the pandemic even Amazon couldn't keep that up and I'm used to getting stuff slower now. More reasons to stop feeling the monster.

I love amazon. That's why it gets 4 stars. I use it daily to purchase things and have been for over 10 years. I can pretty much avoid going anywhere if I want to, because of amazon. However, recently the app will not even open. It continues to crash. I've tried uninstalling updates, restarting my phone... Nothing has worked. Such a bummer because I don't want to have to use chrome to access my account. #bummed #fixitplease

Prime member here for the past 8 years. I love Amazon but they have made many fast changes to the app. I'm not new to technology and even I'm having trouble navigating the app with all its changes. It changes daily and I have trouble navigating between accounts within my household. Also searching past purchases to buy again is impossible. I'm unable to view upcoming delivery to check status. I plan to delete it and just use the computer version which no doubt impact how often I shop.

The app is super laggy when scrolling, has a slow response rate to touch on the screen. It usually times out trying to load just one simple task like scrolling or trying to flip through the pictures. Most of the text links are unresponsive and when you manage to get it to register, that times it out more often than you can actually get them to work. When browsing, it takes so long to load the next page of items.

It seems that if a locked-in preorder price is low (such as that of videogames) they'll arbitrarily cancel the order under the guise of being unable to charge the credit card (months ahead of the release date with money present in associated accounts). But they've been great with any delivery issues encountered, so I'll update my previous rating.

This app is so glitch and the layout needs updating! I used to have Amazon prime and loved it for a time period. HOWEVER, when I do this, my total defaults to the most expensive shipping option. THEN, when I manually click free shipping the app freezes. EVERY SINGLE TIME!

This update is horrible. Crashing occasionally. Putting buttons on the bottom is ridiculous since many of us have our phone navigation that pops up down there. Try to hit "back" on my phone and kept hitting amazon's "home" button. After doing it a bunch I decided amazon wasnt worth the headache. Did you even test this app prior to launching it? Seems unlikely because someone certainly would have realized it was trash.

Always getting items late, what's the point on paying 14 dollars a month for prime if items still not arriving in time. The point on paying is to get your Tuff fast, in that case is better to go to the store and buy them from them or better yet switch to Walmart.

Horrible company. I use to like them for my own convenience. Impossible to find the choice to change country/language settings in the new version when you want to find a product in another country and ship over to you. I think my family and I are very likely going to transition away from Amazon. App had been working fine until recently. Update with UI change happened and now unusable. Constant "something went wrong" errors on home page, searches and product pages. I'm honestly going to cancel my prime. Nothing comes as quick as promised, multiple packages were lost. The app is hard to navigate, you can't find anything anymore. And finding the menu? There is no way for buyers to leave feedback through the app. Basically, positive transaction don't receive feedback, but when someone is unhappy with a purchase they will take the extra steps to leave negative feedback through a web browser. Used to be a phenomenal app, but the new interface is absolutely appalling and confusing, and if you use Dark Mode in Android 10 and 11 (which is most people!) you literally can't even see what you have typed in the search bar! Something changed recently when I try to look at clothes the page does not load right and it does not give me an option to pick a size but there is something about looking for a recommended size however it does not work when I try to put my info in. The app, not Amazon's actual website, but the app itself, runs like dogsh*t. so amazon just took another step forward. splitting up payments for what I assume is customers that have been around for a while and have a credit card on file. I've had good initial experience with Amazon, but then they blocked me from reviewing the garbage I've bought from them. I then made a new account. No option but to use this only app, isn't it? Loads slow, buggy, lame age old UI/UX. It's not an issue with the app itself but with the overall Amazon website. used to be great for customers but now there a ton of scam sellers on the platform and amazon makes you jump through hoops or literally only gives you the option to call USPS when a seller simply does not ship an item.. except they don't even give you a tracking number to reference. ebay is more reliable than amazon now in terms of buyer protection and guaranteed shipping
