this app sucks. I will go over to my computer to use Amazon rather than use the phone app. to look at order status I have to tap 3 or 4 times while I have to wait for the phone to redraw after each tap. what a waste of time. and it randomly keeps asking me if I want prime. I am sick and tired of saying no. and I have to respond to continue. are you guys trying to win an award for the most annoying app? it has only one saving grace. when is displays orders, the delivered orders are last.

Amazon offers a huge variety of products that can be purchased and delivered in a timely fashion. As a prime member, I'm offered early access to a variety of products.. I recently purchased alexa 4th generation hub with super great speaker along with a few echos... I can ask Alexa to add items to my cart and purchase without pushing a button.. Amazon is convenient, accurate, timely and I absolutely love it... no driving to the store waiting in lines etc.. Highly recommend!

I am only leaving a review for the *APP* here, not Amazon itself. Idk what happened with this latest update, but the app is basically useless now! The search freezes up, photos won't load/freeze up, just constantly freezing/crashing. Not cool. Might as well uninstall the app because I am literally using the desktop site on a google tab now. Hoping they fix the app with another update soon!

I do not like the update. Does not make sense to have the main tabs at the bottom. Your hand covers it. I would like my cart back on the top right hand corner where I can see when I add items. The font is too big and the app is much harder to navigate. I need it to be convenient so I can make purchases quickly. Please change it back.

Your app has become unusable since the last few updates. Unable to switch between options within a chosen item or have the item update when chosen to add to the checkout. Unable to add to cart when pressing the add button. I've had to use the desktop option to shop. The app is only good to check on the progress of an order at this point.

I usually love Amazon, but since they started advertising a free trial for their prime subscription, it has been extremely difficult at the checkout page to select the free shipping option. It almost looks like it is don't on purpose. also, do not offer a chat option in your customer service, if after explaining everything you'll be told that a call is needed.

I would give 5 stars to amazon but, I bought prime. When I bought prime everything was going great! There were discounts, almost no shipping fee. But it all started when I went to Prime Video. I realized I had to PAY for movies. Why should I have to pay for movies?! It's why I bought prime so I can have all the discounts, etc. Hope amazon can remove some prices or AT LEAST make them cheaper.

After the last update this app keeps crashing repeatedly on my S6 and Tab S2. It's literally unusable, I can only order from within my web browser now which works fine. Before the update just 2 weeks ago my devices were running this app without issue. Also, on top of being unusable the new menu layout sucks compaired to the last one, it has added extra clicks to get into certain parts of the menu that were more easily assesable in the last version

easily one of the worst apps I've ever used & over the years absolutely nothing has gotten better. you cant pick whatever categories you want & its often picked automatically, options of narrowing down types of items are limited, buttons either dont work or lag for an extremely long time, constantly freezes, crashes, and has frozen my entire phone. horribly glitchy & unreliable. dont even waste your time unless you want to be angry & take 10x longer to get what you need than necessary

New layout is horrble! I use Amazon way more than I should and use it on my phone for 98% of my shopping. The new layout is horrible! The last update made it difficult to navigate and find things. Need to change back to at last the previous update if not a couple ago. The saying if it ain't broke don't fix it holds true here! Love Amazon, hate the new layout

New update is AWFUL! I cannot place orders on Amazon fresh it gives me an error code of oops its something on our end. I have been trying for 2 days and same error. I hate that the buttons haveght moved to the bottom as before the update they were at the tops which was more manageable. Can we reverse and go back to the app used to be before this HORRIBLE update. Please Fix this Soon or i might be canceling my Prime membership. I use the app because it was easier than logging into my computer.

Continues to be poor. On opening the app it often goes to a blank page. Scrolling is slow and jerky. The menu set up at the bottom is poor, however if you re-install the menu reverts to the top....but, only until you close the app...when you restart...back to the bottom. Worst thing....no response from Amazon directly or on here from the developers...why?..well they couldn't care less!

The update is terrible. Had never had any issues before, and enjoyed the shopping experience. However since the update, it crashes regularly, disconnects from the internet, loses my searches, and most irritatingly: rarely loads my account. I'm left unable to check on order updates and delivery times. Absolutely awful.

The app is not allowing my tablet to receive text messages when I left this comment from my tablet the app developer replied and said to do some updates and that it would be fixed. I've done the updates and nothing has changed. Makes the app very useless. I've been working with Verizon for the past 3 days to try to get the situation rectified and they have not been successful either.

App is currently unusable. It crashes upon loading every time it is opened and when it eventually loads it is at a snails pace. I have uninstalled and reinstalled and cleared the cache on both my old and my brand new handset and it has made no difference whatsoever. Seems to be a number of users with this issue and it has been going on several weeks so I don't understand why it has not been resolved by now.

I enjoy using the app to search and place my orders. I have never had an issue. The one thing I wish the app would do is make it easier for the user to know what is causing the app icon to show you have a message waiting with the red numbers. You have to guess and search through the menues what tripped the notification with the red number and sometimes never find the reason. Other than that the app is great.

For the most part I love shopping on Amazon, but lately I will get the little notifications that my stuff is 10 stops away only to click on it and upon it taking me to the app, it still doesn't even appear out for delivery so it's not giving me a way to keep track. Really really irritated with this because I live in a motel so sometimes they don't go to the right door so I like to know when it's only a few stops away so I can wait outside. The tracking part of their app really needs some work

I HATE that the new update took the pages away from search results! Replacing them with "load more." The pages made it easy to go back to an item I was interested in and choose after shopping the other pages. Its like they took the shelf away at the store and now are the products are a mixed up mess on the aisle. This will ABSOLUTELY DETER ME FROM shopping with this app(which is 99% of my amazon shopping experience). Hope you change it back soon!!

I have been obsessed with Amazon since I discovered it and have never had any issues with the app, until the latest update, but now I can't stand it. I uninstalled the update to find that the app is not supported without it. I have to close the app due to constantly glitching and freezes while trying to select items, it really makes my shopping experience unpleasant. Probably won't be purchasing anything until fixed, or a new update is available. Sad.

Was just made aware by a driver I had the wrong address on my packages. Wasn't even aware because multiple orders still got delivered with no problem. When I selected billing address as the same as my shipping address the app should of picked up on the error. Props to the delivery guy that noticed & to the other ones who still delivered my packages as well.

Extremely slow & buggy app. Freezes upon loading even when connected to wifi. Sometimes won't load at all. Takes me resetting my connection & a fresh cache clear EVERY TIME just to get it to work on a basic level. Even then, it won't load my profile page or order history page to check the status on a current order. You'll have an easier time shopping on Amazon through chrome. They get their money either way so they don't have any insentive on improving this app.

12 items, multi orders. Searching was hard. Screen kept glitching around, & they auto grouped my shipments into as few as possible which is hidden & can't remove. I struggle to click on orders & find tracking, just flashes & goes back screens. Most have not shipped & those that have are being shipped way slower than time at purchase, some are usps & doesn't track. Some orders are not shipping C/S doesn't know why, its amazingly hard to contact them, they haven't done what they said to help.

Amazon shopping experience in general is great. Doing online groceries on Amazon using this app is a hassle. First, there is no search bar dedicated for Amazon Fresh or Whole Foods and searching will constantly take you away from the grocery store and show products on Amazon in general. Second, there is no way to know the delivery availability until you go to check out (This could be fixed with an on-screen message displaying the next available delivery time) while adding groceries to the cart.

So since Amazon does not want to use emails as a way to deal with issues, I will write my issue here. I ordered a flash deal item, but then my payment has been declined even though I have more than enough money, and then the price was adjusted since the deals timer ran up, this happened twice for the same item. Increasing the price twice. It's really uncool that Amazon needs to play this game to try to get a higher price than advertised.

My absolute GO TO APPLICATION FOR EVERYTHING, from food to clothes to my dog, and anything in-between. Even though I shop a few more online my fav shops...I always go back to Amazon, I need to check price, or color or "anything" it's always there! And, I trust Amazon..a person can change their mind (return) honestly I have only 1 or 2 issues with Customer Service (3x as many years) but that's their rule and they do seem interested can in the problem, for the length of the call

New user interface is horrible! Had to Uninstall multiple times and still doesn't work. Keeps glitching. If someone sends me a link, it opens in my app but keeps glitching and won't let anything happen. Why change something that works!! Also, everything is GIANT now. Words and images!!

I typically don't have an issue navigating the app, but there was a recent change that I am not feeling. When I search for an item, and then click on the item to explore for purchase clicking the "X" button to get back to the search results is really going to take some getting used to. I would prefer to just hit the back button on my phone, but instead it's just taking me back to the home page. This requires me to search to the item again or click on the Keep browsing. Fewer clicks is best!

Used to be a great app to use...NOW... The new interface SUCKS!!! When I went to look up an archived order from 2020 it only came up with something I regularly order. And its real slow to load after this update. I am tempted to uninstall and just use the website, unless that has also been updated to something that don't work worth a damn. If that's the case then I'll probably drop Prime and go somewhere else.

It's do easy, practical and fast, that is easy to get addicted. Caveat Emptor. Mr. Besos is a visionary man, he visualize that simplifying the buying process, offering topof the line and effortless return policy, combined with fast delivery would lead him to become the richest man on earth. He made a great shopping experience, easy for everyone, on the phone, on the computer, and continues to innovate.

still missing common sense functions. Like nav forward in history, dark theme; and, a shutoff for the insane, greedy, self-serving search algorithm that tries to force us to buy everything except exactly what we are precisely asking for; wasting hours, and limiting Amazon, too. But, it works; tho, can't wait for something better. New version: Why, OH WHY, did you make it worse? Still no night theme; and, now the menu bar is unconfigurably at bottom wasting screenspace & interfering with ctrls.

App is full of bugs. Tells you there's over 1000 items and only let's you scroll through about 6 pages. Also reduces the amount of items when you sort them by price. Not great at all. Plus it would be nice if you could sort by low to high including delivery charges. Nearly caught out by that one..

Not sure what they've done to the app but I've no idea how to navigate round it now! When I click 'buy' nothing happens, & I can't search for music without being hassled by amazon prime. Who thought searching for & downloading music would be so hard! There's a saying...'if it ain't broke....'. Amazon clearly missed that memo!

I was shopping for a projector recently & had questions. Found a forum-type thing where people post short questions & answers about each product, but it was no help. Misleading actually, since the projector I bought was praised as being "easy to use". I posted a question several days ago but received no reply. I prefer Ebay's method of communication w/ sellers. I find the Amazon app to be cluttered & disorganized. Edited 6/7/21, 3 months later: still can't use the projector.

The worst app for downloading mp3s on. Buying an album is easy, really easy.... But getting them to play on your phone, or anything for that matter. CHANGE THE WAY YOU SELL MUSIC, IT'S BS THAT I HAVE TO GO WAY OUT OF THE WAY, TRACK DOWN WHAT I JUST BOUGHT, THEN DOWNLOAD TRACK BY TRACK. Takes way to long. Worse music downloader I've ever used!

there deliveries are super inconsistent, even when I'm paying almost $200 a year. I just started ordering food thinking that It would be a better experience... I was very wrong. not sure how they do things but if a driver is delivering food, they should be able to contact the customer and ARIVE ON TIME! the guy called once before he figured I wouldn't be there and just left the food on another porch for the delivery. very bad customer service did t even offer a solution.never using Amazon again

I had had the worst delivery experiences ever since I came to UAE. Not once, but three times. Yesterday, I had a delivery of a simple phone case. I wanted to make sure it was original. The delivery guy called just 5 minutes prior to the delivery and I was outside and the time period was impossible. He was adamant that he won't be returning for the day, if I miss it, and left it with the security. Turned out the case is a fake. Now I have to return it. No way to rate the delivery experience.

When I open and use the app, the top third portion where the logo and search is, the colored portion, turns all gray when I start scrolling and flickers. I have to close the app and open it again to fix it, but it always comes back. It is so annoying. This has been happening for a few months now. No update has yet to fix it...

Every time I place an order, it gets broken down and charged individually so that almost nothing qualifies for the 'free shipping'. And instead of outright charging my card, they put authorization charges and then refund them so my account shows a charge, but the money is still there. Just put Amazon money on a card by itself plus extra for the random shipping charges that will be added. Add to that the fact that customer service isn't helpful AT ALL!!

I enjoy shopping with this app. Definitely!! üòä The problem I have is that when I need to speak to someone (a humane) it is almost impossible. I can always get the front "answer the phone" person but they always need to notify someone else and then you have to just wait for a call or email.... And the last time I had to call back over 5 times, which was about 3months total...... And my acct. Was locked!!! Very disappointed ü§¨

I've had to uninstall and reinstall the app /twice/ now bc it won't show anything at all when I open it, from the icon OR from a link on browser. Uninstalling is the only fix I've found that works, I've tried messing with storage/app settings, wifi vs data, everything. It's getting really frustrating.

The prior style and user interface of the Amazon App was perfectly fine. And now that everyone has been using that for many years, Amazon decides to revamp it with something that is really not user-friendly, and has bugs. Not happy at all. Amazon just wasted a lot of money fixing something that wasn't broken, and messing it up!

This app is constantly a problem for me. It boots me out randomly or kicks me back to the home screen. I can't scroll through any of my lists because it bounces back to the top. Major complaint is let me set my own search parameters. Just let me set the price I want to see. Not items between $x and $x. I don't understand how it's 2021 and this app acts like it's a decade old. I understand marketing but I don't want to use an app that is 90% harassing marketing and 10% products. I'm done with it.

I have been using Amazon for various things for years. Quite possibly over a decade and I like it. If there were some things I would change it would be, 1) When the delivery options are shown in the checkout section, it would be nice if I could have one button which allows for multiple items to all be delivered on the same day (Prime delivery permitting of course). 2) For Amazon to pay its fair share in taxes. (This is why I gave 4/5 stars)

It's now really hard to contact Amazon through the app. I'd never be rude to customer services but by making it hard to contact you is ensures that people are more likely to be angry when they contact you. It now involves trying to work out the best phrase that will allow you to eventually choose the chat option. It is mot consistent. Had to go to a friends to borrow a computer to contact them in the end as no success in contact on app this time.

I've had the same delivery instructions for years. I put them in on a computer and in the app. Apparently, neither went into my account I found out by talking to customer service. My instructions say front door and indicate I'm disabled. Since COVID most drivers are pretty lazy. So apparently, their system doesn't work and despite calling once before about this it didn't get fixed. Not disability friendly. Also, I've had continual issues ordering delivery from Whole Foods.

It WAS fine. Now this app is so slow that on 4G it refuses to load and on WiFi it's still takes a long time to find results. On top of all this, the original interface was perfectly fine. Easy to navigate and boxes to click on where I expected them to be. Now I don't know where anything is and aren't able to load any pages to find out. Update: after clearing app cache and storage and then removing the app and redownloading. Works fine on 4G now. Will update stars to 3.

Terrible interface. I have a much better experience just using the website in my browser in desktop mode. It's waaaaay too zoomed in. No view options at all. Terrible in landscape mode. Littered with multiple sticky bars at top and bottom that take up screen space. Sticky bars are ALWAYS BAD. They are pure garbage and so is anyone that implements them in an app or website. At least give us some options to turn your stupid garbage off.

Good app, apart from constant rearrangement of the content, just like supermarkets. Also its not easy to find all your own reviews, if you want to update them. A added suggestion would be a scan feature to find a product that you already have, ie, looking for a replacement that you bought before from another outlet. Or to compare it with products sold in the High Street shops that may be available on Amazon.

The latest update is God awful. When searching they've eradicated almost all useful information. Now it's just setup like a tiles for the results view, and it only displays the brand/seller and the price of the item with the picture. Doesn't show average review, number of reviews, or even the description of the item unless you click the product. Absolute nightmare to find anything now

The latest update is horrible. I now have to scroll all the way down a long menu to find my orders, so I can check on their status. This was a top listed link before. Why did this move to the bottom below a very long list of search categories?? I understand trying to consolidate features, but moving one of most the commonly used link to a lower priority level, making it more frustrating for the customers is a disservice and is a horrible programming design! App development team needs to WAKE UP!

Change the layout back for android. I constantly hit the 3 lines at the bottom right because the skin on my hand overlaps the phone. Move everything back to the left side. I dont want to shop after accidentally hitting the button 12 times while attempting to scroll down. Some layouts are for tablets,not curved cellphones which most phones are in 2021. Bring back the layout without buttons at the bottom

New update made app horrible. Is there a way to rate it zero? SMH. There was nothing wrong with the GUI before. Why make it convoluted and difficult. Before I just needed one press to look at my orders. Now I have to select three times just to get to the order page. That defeats the purpose. Fix it Amazon!

The new update doesn't seem to help user with experience. It's more like a treasure hunt to find what he's looking for. A hint screen or something could've helped with users to familiarize themselves with the UI, helps when you go with a huge UI revamp. More over the padding on the left in my accounts page is horrible.

I see where people are not happy with the new version of this app. I wish I could see it but for some stupid reason, Amazon decided to reduce their potential market by excluding anyone with a slightly older phone. My phone is running Android 6 and now this app requires android 7. WHY? To support some new features? How about you let those of us with older phones run without those newer features? We've gotten along this far without them, do you really think we need to have them now? Well, the new features are going to increase our buying? If we can't run the app, we can't buy things so you are LOSING sales. I can't afford to buy a new phone every time somebody decides that I need to have new features and need a newer phone to support them. Bring back the older version of the app that still supports older phones. Thanks!

Love Amazon, but new app is garbage. Old app was ok, search functions were a bit awkward and tiresome..but new app.. It's glitchy, doesn't display items well, and takes forever to load certain pages. Back button won't work properly and the search bar doesn't clear easily. Seems like an untested beta.

Uninstalled. Way too invasive. While I love the convenience of the app and had been using it for years, i just uninstalled because some genius thought it was good idea to push notifications of every supposed promo they have in the store today. I received more than 30 notifications today and uninstalled. I'll likely install back when they fix this but for now, no more impulse buys on the phone

I love Amazon and I love the ease of using the app to order whatever, wherever and whenever. However, I'm knocking off one star for an annoying feature. If I leave the app for a even a split second after searching for something it immediately takes me back to the home page and all the work I've done to search for something is GONE. Disappears completely. To say it's aggravating is an understatement! Fix that and I'll give you back your star.

App works fine, but new layout is poorly designed. Old menu was intuitive and was correctly placed in upper left corner just like other apps. Now I have to go hunting thru 4 icons at the bottom for the option I am looking for. This looks like a redesign for the sake of keeping the designer employed, not for actually making the app better.

App itself works reasonably, other than the 1-click buy which is big enough I sometimes press it while scrolling through books. My biggest issue is how aggressively they push the Prime subscription, which isn't cheap. They offer free shipping, if you sign up for prime which is in small print. If you cancel your subscription, it takes way too many steps. They penalize you for choosing the non-prime shipping through more expensive means, and will actively separate items so you pay xtra shipping.

I pay for the prime membership and the items still take forever to ship, last items o ordered took them 6 days to ship, I don't see the point on spending money on something that just doesn't do what it's supposed to which is to "ship items faster". You need to go back and offer the same quality service that you used to provide us with.

been using this app for years, within the past 6mo the quality of this app has taken a huge nosedive. it constantly stalls out, taking multiple attempts opening and closing the app to load the front page, randomly giving you "oops something happened" dogs as you browse, and most infuriating, if you have things in the cart/saved for later you will often get "important message about something in your cart" that is totally unclickable and will go away, leaving you guessing what it could have been.

I've used Amazon for years but it's just gone downhill as of lately. Ever since they started using USPS to deliver my packages it's been horrible! My packages are not being delivered on time, just sitting at the facilities for days, getting delivered to the wrong addresses, they don't follow my delivery instructions, etc. I pay for Prime and I'm starting to wonder if it's worth it at this point. I used to LOVE this company and never had any problems. It's disappointing.

After the update I don't see any items in my cart, only the total price of the items I added before the update. So I can't see what I'm buying or edit my cart. As someone that works on an e-commerce app, this update is catastrophic to sales. I'll have to use the website until this is fixed. Edit: Uninstall/Reinstall didn't work so the app is broken. Using a Samsung S20 Ultra.

Service was better prior to the horrible updates. I can't even change my phone number for the OTP login..It keeps using my old number, customer service was no help they couodnt do it either and to top it off deliveries are late. Nothing scheduled for next day delivery is going through ive had 2 orders with 3 day delays this past week. Saying they would arrive this week. The 2 completely different items were on the daily deals list. Definitely not renewing next year, service is going down.

Usually Amazon is great but this past week the app has crashed numerous of times. Not sure if it was an update, but had to uninstall and reinstall the app at least 5 times along with multiple phone restarts. And my orders that were supposed to come this week are late and haven't gotten anything! I ordered something on the 16th and I PAY for prime. Nothing! If this keeps up I'll be forced to shop elsewhere. 1st world problems! Smh.

Had Prime for many years. I ordered items and they were running real late. Canceled order and reordered. Again items running late. Then a set of other items came and part of items were missing. For the items that were running late customer service would only refund or reorder for me and stated themselves the items were misplaced. I cancled my Prime membership. So disappointed because this wasn't the first time and help wasn't helpful

The changes aren't all user-friendly. For instance, I can't read more than the 1st line of a review when looking at the pictures that reviewers have posted. Additionally, the account icon (now moved to the bottom of the screen) does not list all of my account-related items. That must be found under My Account in the drop-down menu.

They moved the "your orders" button and "your account" button to the bottom of the page, creates a completely jarring experience. Then when navigating it returns to the top of the page. Makes the whole app more difficult to use. Please put it back or give people the option to toggle it where they like.

I love using Amazon Prime. But Amazon lack a decent Search engine. There are no options to put in " " or + or - to narrow down our searches and make it specific for what we want to search for. For example... If I want to buy 5L IPA, I get shown all litre sizes for single item sellers. I don't want results for sizes I have no interest in. **** Please make a better search feature. You have the money to do it, and it doesn't cost that much to make a small edit.

The Developer needs to FIX ALL THE BUGS!! The old app was great. Now, it won't allow you to access/select items to see the information on. Just gives you a price range. Tried to research ice skates and air mats for gymnastics and I finally had to stop because I became soooooooo frustrated üòû!! DON'T LIKE IT AT ALL NOW!! IF IT AIN'T BROKE, DON'T FIX IT!!!!

I don't normally write reviews, but this new interface is the worst! Hit the back button? Exits the app. Search for a few minutes? Might as well restart the app to get to your lists, cart, etc. A real pain to deal with. I don't like Amazon shopping anymore.

This app is a mess. I've removed it and reinstalled it twice. It opens up normally, then after awhile all the icons move to the bottom of the page. Orders can't be opened, sometimes shopping cart can't open. Deals jump into the view whether I want to see them or not. You need to fix this mess Amazon!

STILL a rubbish app now.... STILL bloated out with no common sense to its layout... far to much going on, Everything about your account, settings, history etc is difficult to find and use.... Shortcuts: no description of where these are, but did find them. And 'My Stuff' needs to be at the top of this shortcut list. And why not make the shortcut list customisable... Most options take too long to load up, or do not load up, or the app freezes.

Since the recent update v22.12.2.100 I've just been unhappy with the app. It takes too long to load any kind of menu adverb when on home wifi. It needs some severe optimizing before I can be satisfied. On the disability side however, it seems like words and buttons are larger so that might help some people. For me however it just means more scrolling.

Major user interface issues. Swiping/scrolling on an Android phone is still problematic; the app detects almost any touch as a tap, so it ends up opening random items. When opening an item from another app (Google) the back button should take you back to Google; instead, as soon as you go into the Amazon app, you're "stuck" in it; hitting back brings you to wherever you left off last time you were in the Amazon app. Search field is quirky; you can't change the text in it, you always start over.

I have had no problems getting all kinds of things off Amazon. But the past 3 months I'll be lucky if I even get it. Everything from barh bombs to a dress. I have noticed with the items that never come they d Io nt track the orders just says it was shipped but not when it's coming or anything like that then once the day passes where it's supposed to be here to just says running late. There are items that never made it to be that says running late and I have no option to refund it.

I've bought quite a few things off Amazon with ease. Unfortunately the last few months every other 'next day delivery' order I make, I get a message saying, "We're sorry your delivery is late. If you have not received your package within 3 days you can come back here for a replacement or refund" I understand things happen that are out of their control, but it's been happening way too many times; making it very unreliable. The main reason I used Amazon was for the Next day delivery option.

Glitchy app, sometimes the digital images on the screen shakes up and down continuously and won't stop until you exit the app. It also won't let me add photos to reviews since the popup window that arises for this option won't allow me to choose a photo from my gallery or take one from my camera to attach to the review.

Please return the app to how it was before! The listings are too big to scroll through, and the settings were paired down exponentially. It's too overwhelming to look through. I can't browse items on mobile like I could before. The shopping cart is in a terrible place and nothing feels accessible.

Generally fast and easy to use but sometimes it does glitch out and lag or be unresponsive. Also sometimes categories are useless and used as just a big ad with a slash image promoting something new, specifically in my case the video game section just being a big ad for the new consoles and not letting you see the list of games unless you actually search out exact titles with almost way to just browse like before.

The new version of the app sucks big time. The biggest issue I have found is that they removed the ability to track your orders. It gives you a estimated day but that is it. Amazon must have felt they were tracking their prime shipments way much better then the competition so they decided to mess theirs up. It really isn't fair to embarrass the shipping giants like they did but no worries Amazon their shipping up now.

Amazon itself is a really good place to order products especially when you need them as soon as possible, the app is nice, after my order didn't arrive or got delayed, I couldn't start a refund through the app, you have to login through a computer or to chat with customer support, it took them 2-3 minutes to issue a replacement or a refund for me because the package was lost. Really good experience.

Loved the app until the new update 5/2021. They changed the UI and ruined it and now my cart is bugged out and I can't access it. It just goes to my recent search. Literally can't purchase anything on Amazon. That's like not being able to search anything on Google. Why fix what's not broken. It was perfect before. Edit-9/2021 STOP MOVING EVERYTHING AROUND WITH UI UPDATES. JUST QUIT. IT GETS WORSE WITH EVERY UPDATE.

I used to really like the Amazon app - primarily because the search was so easy to customise and had a real depth of filters. But those seem to have gone. You can't filter by product features any more and the sort low to high cost seems to give you complete rubbish barely related to your search terms. Previously this app was 5 stars, now it's 3, and only because the checkout functionality is so easy and the order history is so good!

Though I work for Amazon's competitor, I shop here b/c of its wide range of products. Shipping is EXCELLENT. I absolutely LOVE when I do a search for certain items, I get accurate results or something very similar. Search for MEN'S sneakers, I see a wide range of JUST MEN's sneakers, unlike other sites that shows items that are totally irrelevant. 1 thing I would like Amazon to change is the review process. Reviews are left on items that has ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to do with that ITEM.

Overall the app is fine. The correspondence with customer service sucks! I was promised a resolve to my issue four times. Each of them didn't happen. I even copy and pasted previous messages to help convey what I was told. I still would have to go ever everything each time. They'd say they read it, but it was obvious they hadn't. Full refund was promised, yet even after two more interactions, I still received "nothing I can do", even after attaching previous messages.

The app gets a little sluggish at times because Amazon has many customers. Sometimes packages get intercepted. The last time a shipment of water was said to be undeliverable to the post office, I received a message saying that I would receive reimbursement. To date, I have not been reimbursed. The last time a delivery was not received, reimbursement funds were credited to my account. I am wondering why not. Suggestion: Divide sections of Amazon into departmental apps. It's possible.

Issues with last two updates: Interface is now optimised for oversized screens, so on normal smart phones (not compact sized, just normal) more of the screen is wasted to oversized icons. Some of the icons don't even show up, not sure why. For example I have no idea what stars I'm giving when reviewing products, because the stars are not visible. They are there and clickable, but not visible. Other, similar functional issues. Devs: Please give us a setting where we can revert to older UI.

Bad UX, bad Customer Support. I'm on the phone for 30 minutes, they keep redirecting me just to send me an email a few hours later that they didn't find a problem with my account. For context, I could not access my account because their 2factor notification never arrived to my phone. Ended up resetting my password to solve the problem. I did know the correct password, it was just the workaround I found for 2fac. Would be nice if a fortune 2/500 corporation had a proper login system / support.

The control bar with the shopping cart icon moved to the bottom of the screen -- WHY? No benefit to that, and need to retrain my eyes . The "sort by" and 'Prime only" contro5 also disappeared so I had to look at all 697 trash bag listings, randomly presented as to price and shipping. Un- and /reinstalling fixed that, happily, but, but the issue reflects poorly on the update. What's good? Well, so far at least, no rummaging around the storerroom " msgs & YAY for that. üòä

The app attempts to force you to use the Alexa voice recognition every time you use it. Despite declining to enable this and give it permissions for my mic, every time I unlock my phone and open the app it pops up trying to get me to turn it on. No way to disable this notification, it's an intrusive and annoying way to get you to give the app access to functionality you might not want to give it.

Changed phone, now I can't login because it sends and waits for an activation to the very same app that doesn't start until the activation is accepted. I will ditch Amazon cancelling Prime. Lately many products can be bought elsewhere with better prices and better service. Many opportunists buy products in other places and sell it in Amazon twice the price and double the shipping time. Get out of the comfort zone and give them a run for their money uninstalling it.

I really like shopping on Amazon. it is quick easy and efficient... except for when you're trying to get an order for filled by a seller who ships your package to the other side of the country and the refuses to answer you nor do you get any assistance from Amazon. if it's fulfilled by Amazon then it's pretty easy to get it taken care of if there's a mistake made. so I just be cautious when buying from third party sellers.

Used to love it but Everytime I try and chat with customer service now the box I type in to is covered up with my keyboard. My phone is up to date and I've uninstalled and installed the app several times so it's definitely the app itself. It's very slow also and crashes a lot. My phone is brand new so I know it's not my phone. No problems with any other app except this one.

Amazon is really convenient and arrives quickly which is great. However, their new policy of not accepting Visa credit cards due to the fees from visa is ridiculous. Amazon is well known for reducing the amount of t x it pays. To completely inconvenience its customers by not accepting certain types of payment is shortsighted and destructive. While I won't completely stop using amazon, I'll certainly look elsewhere first for my purchases. Not goid customer service Amazon!

They just made a great app not great anymore. Now it takes more clicks to order, unwanted screen pops up with items they want you to buy in addition. It even runs slow. Set my billing address to a shipping address I used weeks ago. Not noticing it, I had to cancel, then reorder. Makes no sense

New app is so bloated it takes five or more steps just to get to your orders and information. sponsored ads and unrelated products make search results unreliable. This clutter is frustrating to us that preferred a focused search to quickly find specific products for purchase. I now give up and go to another source to find something that previously was so easy on Amazon. Shame!

With each update this only gets worse and less usable. Using the app or even the website has become more frustrating and unpleasant with every change, to the point where I don't even want to do it anymore, and now I'll only do it for things I can't easily get elsewhere. Particularly infuriating is that search filter options have been reduced to almost nothing, they're virtually useless now. Making something less useful and convenient doesn't make it better! Why do you need to be told this?

I guess my shopping with Amazon after 10 years plus has ended, Amazon updated it's app, I'm no longer able to even install the app. I noticed my app was no longer on my phone I go to install again, I can't download it, doesn't even say there's an error. This issues screws everything up, I'm connected to prime, connected to Alexa I can't do anything

This app is broken. Filtering from low to high extends or reduces search results. It often puts in items that have nothing to do with keywords. Its inaccurate price per item. And u have a rough time afjusting the 10 search results u get first. Overall its far behind the webpage. Frustrating and inefficient, unless u want to buy of wishlist.

What is going on? I have been using this app for over a year, now it keeps crashing over and over, I cant even open it anymore. I have tried to restart my phone, and also re-download the app. But keeps crashing. This is absurd, if they want my money they better get this to work. (Using a samsung note9 android)

This app is completely unable to open from links in emails. Any time I get a notification about a delivery I can't open the tracking info from the email, I have to go to the app separately and navigate from there which is incredibly annoying. You would think one of the largest tech companies would have a functional phone app.

No consistency with shipping. It tells me dremmel bits, and radio antennas are hazardous materials. After about an hour on the phone. Amazon doesn't know why they won't ship to me. The automated online support raises the bar at being ineffective. Never have I so rapidly gone in circles. Only to get further away from what I was after. Save yourself the headache and go to the store. One year update, things have only gotten worse.

Amazon drivers sucks. For the past couple of items I ordered it went two ways. They either didn't follow instructions nor take pictures. Or they deliver it to the wrong place which is across the street from my place. I should know because I receive packages that's for another apartments across the street from mines. Is it that hard to deliver the packages to my front door and take a picture like how they use to? This is very aggravating.

I dislike the new icon. It makes it harder to find in my phone apps. More importantly since the icon has changed it is SO SLOW!!!!! It is fine when I search for an item but once I click on the item and try to choose different options from the seller, the app completely freezes. I have to shut it down and start all over. It is way to frustrating for me to use. I feel my blood pressure rising when I try to shop on this app!! I will try again in a few weeks. Do better Amazon!

Horrible. Amazon is up to some sneaky business. Account set up and prime sign up is extremely easy. However, to end prime subscription an email has to be sent at your request. But there will never be a confirmation asking if you intended to have prime or not. Just charge the card, charge a card from a year ago no problem. Multiple charges at once for prime or any other services and its not the first time. These people are in everyones pockets charging subscriptions with no one the wiser.

First, the new app layout is just a hassle and way to complex. Secondly, Lightning deals and regular deals need to be more user relevant. I highly recommend that the Deals category creates a new section like "My recommended deals." To create the most effective display of relevant deals all users will be able to pick certain brands, categories and or keywords the match their interests which can be altered at any time. Third, there needs to be better customer service. Otherwise decent shop app.

I hate the new logo. They should bring back the old one. The new one makes me not want to click on it. So ugly. I haven't updated my app, cuz I don't want the new one, so I still have the old logo. Also, prime deliveries are not always 2 day deliveries or prime delivery. Have to wait a week sometimes. Not worth paying for prime if theres no benefit. I'm planning on canceling b4 I get charged again.

A company too big for its own good. And their useless, disinterested so called customer services. When things go wrong, no way to put it right. Amazon you suck, at so many different levels, but that's what happens when there's zero accountability. So easy to hit that click to 'Buy Now' button but have a problem, issue, query, no one's interested. The deal is done and end of story.

In general the app is great. Easy to use. The reason for an average review is how they show the invoice in the app. It does not necessarily match how they bill the credit card. To really see that we have to use the website. We waste so much time trying to figure out what some of the charges are from Amazon due to their app. Why can't they show the actual billing in the app like they do on the website!? Extremely frustrating. Almost forced to order one thing at a time or waste our time.

Will never use Amazon ever again. For unknown reasons they won't disclose, I started getting double "authorization holds" in my bank account for each item, plus they want to charge me a 3rd time when an item actually ships. What f***ing business needs to take triple the cost of an item before shipping and then send 2/3 of it back in a week or 2? That is so shady. Sounds more like they are taking extra funds and letting it collect interest until they have to send it back. Worst company ever.

I don't understand why Amazon keeps making their apps less appealing and more stripped down, year over year. This time, the different tabs were changed to work like tabs in a browser. Meaning that a search offsets whatever tab you have in the foreground. And the menus look really low quality now. Just block text on white backgrounds. Was this release a mistake? Was it supposed to be a development build that was fully released? This looks like a piece of appstore shovelware!

Gives a slightly more mobile-optimized shopping experience than the website. However, last week it began pushing deceptive ads as alert messages on my phone. The ads indicate that I have an update waiting for the Amazon App Store, which I don't have. This ad would convince most readers that by tapping the ad, they will be updating an installed app instead of installing a new app. Amazon: Advertise if you must. But, at least be truthful about it. **Messages blocked**

Sadly even after update the Canadian app isn't fixed, Only the universal ones are fixed except the Canadian app, which still has the same issue with freezing and unable to add or proceed to checkout. I've been with Amazon for over 10 years, purchases from Amazon universal and local ... Why am I paying my Prime locally and having to deal with this.

Extremely frustrating and useless to me. Every time I open an Amazon link in on my chrome browser, it doesn't redirect me to the app it just sits there and pretends to open something. Then when I manually click on the Amazon app it has a white screen then closes out and says this app has stopped working. I've deleted the app and redownload it twice and tried different accounts. Nothing fixes it.

It is what it is. No dark theme, only brite screaming white. One would think, as the leader in online shopping that Amazon would have the best shopping app. The controls for following products leaves a lot to be desired. The filters being set, then sorting by price, sorts items by price, but continuing on, starts the products from sorted again, according to one of the filter's settings. You'd think they would know how to program this correctly. The app functions poorly sometimes and is clunky.

They do not understand the questions asked because you can't reach someone who speaks English. 2 day shipping may take a week. I mostly now purchase Amazon only shipped items and name brands because the other products sold especially third party items are over priced junk including some fake items. They do have some good items but I don't purchase much from Amazon now because of the horrible CS.

This review is for Amazon as a company. I used to love Amazon and bragged about their great customer service but it has gone downhill over the last 2 years. I have had several notifications that my package was delivered but it hadn't been, only for it to show up a couple of days later. I've had several packages get lost and never show up (always seems to be the items that recently dropped in price by a lot). I have my package delivered to my neighbor on multiple occasions. 2018.. last good year.

I have loved the interface up until the latest update. It looks like they've reverted to a beta format that has been dumbed down to the point of unusability. It's disappointing and counterintuitive to use now. I need to find a way to roll back the previous version or use the mobile site in lieu of the app. This interface is embarrassing.

The convenience is great. Most the time all my packages are here when it says it will arrive. Huge selection of items. The only thing I was annoyed about was receiving two mugs and one was broken. I ordered a replacement. The box arrived and as soon I picked it up I new it was broken. I didn't bother opening the box. I was directed to drive 20-25 miles to a UPS to send back. During Covid-19 in December. I have ordered hundreds of items. Many items are expensive. Wasn't happy but understand.

This app is easy to use, easy to understand and searches are often spot on! Even if you search for the wrong words, they will always suggest you something quite precise to what you're looking for. Amazon in general has an awesome client service, all problems from fraudulent purchases to reimbursements have been dealt with the most professionalism and care. It's trustworthy and easy to use.

I don't know what you did with this app, but you took an app that worked and basically made it unusable. I click on an item in my list and it brings me to home. If I search and click on a product same result. Back to home. The UI is also terrible too. Whoever is responsible for allowing this update to go through needs a talking to.

amazon's customer service is generally really quick and friendly, but the app makes getting into contact with them awful. if you exit the app or your screen goes dark, the chances of you getting back into your support chat are next to none. the service ai is also completely useless, and mentions having someone call me despite the fact that i don't have my number on my account. it also doesn't correctly update for things like your order being mispicked, and will show an incorrect delivery date.

I really enjoy shopping on Amazon for anything, anytime, anywhere, and for anyone. With Prime shipping is usually very good in regards to wait time and hey, who doesn't appreciate free shipping! With clothing they offer advice on which size to purchase, suggestions on compatibles to compliment your wardrobe. Speaking of wardrobe there's that option to try before you buy which is super financially convenient. If a house doesn't work out, just send it back, no hassle. Could go on but no space left

Recent problems with 2 things on my updated google pixel 3. 1. When clicking an Amazon link, the app starts and fails to load. I see my previous screen with a gray bar at the top with the name of the app. 2. Shopping cart fails to clear after completing a purchase. I just double bought a book: I opened the app and saw I was on the last page of checkout and assumed that I'd neglected to press the last button. Turns out I had already bought it.I have caught this a couple other times.

My phone tries to force me to use the app, the app that I can't uninstall and if I click uninstall it just changes the button to open app. its irritating clicking a link to a product and having my phone forcfully redirect to the app that then loses the link to the product in order to give me a crapload of ads to amazon features and tries to get me to log in to the app despite being logged in on my browser instead.

I agree, Prime Day is a joke. Got an email listing a deck box, tried to order, got a message can't be delivered to my address. Went back to email I got and under comments at least 8 people mentioned the same thing,just about every state item couldn't be delivered. I called customer service, useless, had no idea why. Found item again today...surprise, surprise, item was full price and could be shipped to my location. What gives, Amazon?

Definitely easy to navigate within app... I really prefer online shopping over going to the store anymore, so happy it's something we have as an option as consumers. Another huge reason for this preference is being able to research a product/item before buying by using reviews. I love this! Helps me get an good idea of what to expect/whether I'll like what I'm buying.

Used to be a great app until most recent update. Slow, filters are useless, checking Prime means nothing because items no longer arrive in the 2-day window. Sometimes items take up to 2 weeks. Please put drivers on regular routes like the post office so they actually read the delivery instructions and don't do the exact opposite of the directions. Also give all Prime members a break in the annual rate if you are no longer really giving us free 2-day Prime shipping. The logout process is awful.

I hate the update. Things much harder to find. They needed to leave it alone. The update sucks. The old version was so much better and more user friendly. Now I rather use Amazon on a PC versus the app because so much easier then this horrible update. I used to see random things to buy with this app they made it worse and let's not talk about the huge font. Searching has gotten worse. Trying to find orders is like a scavenger hunt. Please switch it back. And the new icon is terrible!!

Awful since the update, menu looks clunky and all over the place and i literally cannot look at items in any of my wish lists, it just sends me back to the homes screen, so i cant even make purchases. Massive own goal, revert to the old interface, i dont care who thinks it looks good or whatever corporate tosh they will spout, it doesnt work and your customers dont like it and cant even make purchases, quite a problem for you lot. Fix it sharpish or i will be forced to take my custom elsewhere

A good app to buy things and if you do not like it return it. Their return policy is the best hands down. However, to contact a buyer is PANFUL!!vEbaay's contact sellers system overlaps this one by a mile! It would save so much time than having to return an item. I have no idea why I need to go through Amazon rather than contacting the seller/retailer myself! De to this matter alone they lose a star for me. There is room for improvement. It all depends on. Amazon.

Not a fan of this update. The new interface sucks. Ever heard of the phrase "if it isn't broken don't fix it" ? Well that's what they did here. Unfortunately as the only superstore online and no real competition I'll continue using them but I just wanted to note my disdain for the new layout. Note I don't leave reviews often for anything especially apps so hopefully that helps to empathize my disdain for the updated app. Edit 8-2-2021 and again the new app update is a doubling down on above.

How the mighty have fallen, this was once intuitive and easy to use, now the process of searching for things is convoluted it makes searching for things tedious, as Amazon seems more concerned with pushing the digital streaming versions of media, as opposed to the physical, leading you to have to search through the recommendations listed halfway down the page to hopefully stumble upon what you're looking for.

Searching, purchasing, navigating, tracking, etc doesn't work in mobile browser or app. Would be great if the app didn't just redirect with broken links to the home screen every time. Not a one time issue either. Oh to have billions and not know how to create a functional app

Lately I have not been able to request free shipping on my orders even though the items qualify for free shipping. The choices are there, but when I choose it my page becomes faded and won't let me place the order. I am willing to wait one more day to get free shipping; yet I am forced into paying shipping cost. Seems coercive to me. Unfair. This app needs to be fixed.

Better than eBay... by far! Scams are harder to run as opposed to eBay. Even after I fell "victim" to just 1 scam with Amazon last year , it was a pillow-fight (unlike eBay's failures in catching & fixing obvious scams) in comparison. Not getting a real/original/copy-written DVD that a listing claimed to be selling & showing --- instead sending a burnt DVD in a case doning an insert that's CLEARLY printed from home on cheap paper is far more concerning once it's clear how long it takes to fix!

Having items delivered during the pandemic has been a life saver. Amazon has a great selection of quality items and when something doesn't live up to my standards returning most items have been easy. I do wish that when sellers won't refund full price or the shipping to return is more than the price Amazon would ban the seller if they don't refund full cost.

App is unusable. Get "the dogs" picture with an "oops, something went wrong" no matter what I do. Search for a product? Oops, something went wrong. View past orders? Oops, something went wrong. Even something as simple as going to the home page? It works on the website, but in the app, yup, you guessed right, oops, something went wrong! Get it together amazon. You are a prime example of why you need to be broken up. Update: it's happening again!

Even over wifi, the Amazon Shopping app is excruciatingly slow on my Moto G7. It takes forever for product images to load and editing/deleting wish list items is painful. The more you scroll, the longer it takes for product information to populate. If you select a product, the back function often times doesn't take you back to where you left off and you have to start from the beginning of the scroll. These problems aren't duplicated on the Amazon tablet version of the app, which is telling.

After the recent update the top and bottom bars flicker so fast it could cause seizures for sensitive groups. Before and after the update, the app changes what I enter in the search no matter what I've tried, like overactive autocorrect. I can't search for things in my size or for products with a purposefully incorrectly spelled name, like a z instead of an s.

The quality of the product search is GARAGE! Sometimes (more like often) I know exactly what I am looking for and don't need you breaking apart my search string with your sponsored or previously viewed products that don't even come close to my search even when using boolean operators to filter for very specific criteria. It has become obvious that amazon does not care to meet your exact needs but wants to push you towards high profits margin items at the expense of your customers ACTUAL NEED!

Been with Amazon for years and there great. However this last update is ridiculously foolish. Not only does it load slow but it is hard just trying to get to your cart. Why fix something that isn't broke. Makes no sense at all. Go back to the old app that worked every time and was so much easier to navigate.

The newest update for android is awful. It's very slow to load photos half the time other times information is missing from the page. Like I cannot see reviews for an item. Very sluggish now. It was perfect before the update. I've been shopping with Amazon for 20 years. This is my first negative experience.

App attempting to send notifications to a device NOT on my device list, so I can sign in (with correct password) to a flex account. . . Then once finally in. . . . No applying, just a msg that I will receive an email WITHIN A FEW WEEKS!?! What happened to this being a quick process? How can I apply if I am not given the opportunity to put ANY of my relevant info in the system? Why does it keep throwing me back to my shopping account? And why does it have a device listed that I DO NOT have?

I finally uninstalled the app because it's wholly unusable for me. Every time I tried to see something in the browser, the app co-opted it and opened up the app. I wasn't able to get a loaned book because the app sent me to a page where it tried to SELL it to me. Additional issues included the fact that there's no way to leave delivery instructions that actually pertain to my situation. Delivery instructions have not been followed to the point where I had to call customer service 3x in 1 week.

What a fraudulent company! I was given a gift card by a friend, deposited it and made sure the money was there. 2 days later, when I came to pay for a purchase with it, the $ just disappeared as if it was never there. Amazon refused to return the money, saying it was spent by another account somehow and that they couldn't do anything about it. I was given the runaround by CS and their gift card dept with zero accountability on their part! Never buy their gift cards, you'll lose your $!

Overall, Amazon has been excellent. However, there are problems with getting furniture items and, more so, with electronic items. A furniture item I ordered on Amazon got lost in shipping. How you lose a large item of furniture I don't know. A friend of mine also tried to order two drones, and he had a hell of a time getting them to him. He had to go through the tracking system twice to finally get them. So Amazon still has big problems it needs to fix. But for small items, it's great.

The Buy Now option should have a single card locked to it so that it's not using the last used card by default. The app tries to automatically open but it partially loads and freezes after clicking on an Amazon product on a website. You can't leave the chat with an Amazon support rep within the app to do something like navigate other areas of the app for information, otherwise it disconnects you from the person who was helping you.

New UI is poor. I hate the location of the home, cart and setting buttons at the bottom. They tend to get in the way when using the application to shop. This change was a step backwards. The old layout took less space and was in a place that everyone is familiar with that didn't interfere with shopping.

Used to love this app but now the suggested words don't pop up in drop down menu and the search results page is not right. This is really aggravating because I use it a lot. Plus now you can rarely use the gift card scan feature. It doesn't scan no matter the lighting. The worst is getting rid of Pantry. It seems Amazon has made so much money now they don't care about the customers anymore. Everything has gone downhill and I don't know why I'm writing this review instead of just cancelling Prime

Oh my goodness! If you already don't have this app well it's never to late! It's has everything under the sun you can think of to buy and for the cheapest prices from anyone! Shopping is also free. If you upgrade to amazon prime you get 2 more apps plus always free shipping and next day shipping offered. I couldn't live without it. Yes they even deliver food! I mean everything!

Too many glitches when trying to make a purchase keep saying Please renew your payment method After 3 times of doing it than it finally does it. sometimes it will say purchased the item and they will never take their payment until 3 or 4 days later You could Spend the money not knowing they never took the money you spent on that item. Is extremely annoying it even made my bank account go negative... wish they would fix this If they don't will definitely start buying other places.

If you leave this app open, even with back ground data turned off, it will eat data doing God knows what indefinitely. I don't know what it's downloading, but after getting 2 months of overages where my family inexplicably used 6GB more data than any other month in the last ten years, I started tracking usage. On my phone this so 6 used 4GB of data in it's own with minimal active use. I removed it and have to use the web page, but it does the same thing even in lite mode so it's wifi only now

Amazon is my best friend! I rarely have to go into a shopping mall. Talk about convenience, they are #1 hands down in my book both personally and professionally. If there is an issue they are fast to correct it. They even give replacements before you have to send the damaged or faulty products back. My experience with Amazon has been great!

Ratchet update to point where I'm ready to eliminate totally. Every time I log on I must keep removing old things from my list REPEATEDLY.....delivery is slow, what is fee for? Half the time they don't get instructions right, don't even get me started on third party vendors. I'm sure #Amazon will block this but they do not post negative reviews. I have so many emails of items they refuse to publish because it doesn't have to "do with the product" #amazon reply, FIX or not??? Bad app

I dislike ordering anything from amazon because WHEN there's an issue they can't resolve it without me having to jump through chutes, hoops & ladders to get things resolved for their customer service department when it's supposed to be the other way around! This is why I can count on maybe 1 hand what I've ordered from them! Don't waste your time...just deal directly with the manufacturer, if possible, when ordering anything! Amazon customer service/care.... you all need to do sooo much better!

Buggy & slow since update. Ever since the last two updates it's so buggy and slow I will leave my phone and come back and it still hasn't added my item to the cart. I've abandoned several shopping tries & went to the manufacturer & ordered directly. Amazon is losing my business. Free shipping is nice but taking 20 minutes to order something is ridiculous.

It's impossible to log out. I googled how to log out and apparently the people writing these articles aren't aware that the log out option doesn't exist. Also my "lists" disappeared. I couldn't figure out what happened and realized that somehow I was logged in under a different account that I know I have never used with the app (only with a browser). Also Alexa was activated. I don't use Alexa. Something is fishy there.

I've had a lot of problems with Amazon lately. It won't accept just about any of my cards Visa or not. And there is definitely money there. They don't send a notification when they say you have to "change payment method" and still push the shipping back so had I not checked we would have just been waiting and waiting. Just wish the app cooperated for me and that customer service was actually helpful.

I appreciate the ease of shopping on Amazon when I do not feel like shopping till I drop, lol. I enjoy Amazon Prime and I really appreciate that whenever I have had issues, and sellers would not respond to my emails(only happened a few times) an Amazon rep would always step in and rectify the situation. Some items are definitely knock offs, when it comes to clothes and shoe shopping, but overall, I am pleased with my shopping experience.

Has anyone else notice, nobody's watching the hen house? Sellers listing a delivery date, but than ends up changing once the order is processed, to 5 - 7 day delivery, not 2. Sellers listing items at one price and you click on item, item ends up being double or triple the price. Sellers putting incorrect descriptions so their items end up in your search wasting your valuable time as you have to scroll thru the BS. Not renewing my membership. I'm tired of getting ripped of on time and money.

when writing a review from this app and adding photos you can only add photos stored locally on the device no photos from Google photos or from OneDrive photos so you actually have to manually download cloud saved photos. Stupid app. You can't search reviews, just use the website, I guess. I used the phone's back button instead of the in app navigation and had to start my search query all over again.

I finally got used to the new layout and it got changed again, but it doesn't make sense for usability. My orders, which is generally why I click the navigation icon in the bottom right corner, is now buried as a subheadings and is way down at the bottom. The other reason I would hit that icon is to check on my account which is now at the very bottom, also as a subheading. Is data showing people really click to browse departments more often than they check their order status?

Filter, Filter, Filter...if you have Amazon Prime you would think that we would be offered the best at the best price. I don't want to go to a garage sale. Stopped functioning. Shows pictures of dogs and an "UH-OH, something went wrong." Uninatalled. Reinstalled. Now the app can't load pictures - the links are all broken. Worst buying experience, getting blocked again and again, for this reason losing reservation on items with low stock. Easy to use, buy so much here. ridiculously easy to use, I should say. prime member. makes so much sense to shop online and have things delivered. been using the app for years, don't see much of a difference in the changes that occur, only improvements each time, easier and easier to spend more money, which the hubby just loves...

Its an ok app, layouts good etc. Few issues tho- cant zoom in to products while searching, and If you go off the app for longer than a few hours it loses your search and you're back on the homepage which can be really frustrating when you've been clicking through reccomendations to find the right thing. Due to this i dont use it as much as i would and often just go to the website through my internet browser... Its personally not suited but is still a good app and could be useful for others.

Everytime I go to change the shipping option in my cart, the app just spins for several minutes until I give up and close the app and shop somewhere else. Fine with me. You are making it easier for me to NOT buy from you and find other options. I have even restarted my phone and uninstalled and reinstalled the app. This has been going on for weeks. I give up. Not worth the time.

Glitchy. Scrolling right through color options of items and the screen goes blank. Not an internet issue, and the app is up to date. Search options don't work right as well. If you set your search to less than $25 you still get more expensive options...and not just their "suggested" options

I have really come to rely on Amazon a great deal. this app is great because it reminds you of things you have been looking for, tells of deals and gives quick access to delivery status and access to change or edit orders on the spot. I especially love that they updated the app to include the smile.amazon program so donations are still made even if not on the specific website but on the phone app.

Update: an Amazon vendor (victorinox) accepted and held a payment for a product for 3 weeks and posted a long delivery time. They canceled my order and refunded my money after 25+ days post order. Amazon removed my review on the vendor. Lots of products. Many are extremely low quality. Many incorrect labels of shipment times (more than 75% of products arrive late despite that I pay extra for 2 day shipping.) Customer service is non existent. Loyalty to customers is non existent.

Stutters when scrolling wishlist and can't scroll down. Difficult to remove items from list slow on browser. I hate this app. I hate that you have to set up parental controls in order to ask for a password every time you make purchase. Update #2: now they've taken the menu button away completely that used to be able to view departments. I love amazon but for the past few days whenever I try to open the app it will go to a white page and then will close. The new interface good looking just missed the old layout it was easier to manage stuff this one just causes confusion as everyone button has been rearranged so it a tad of struggle looking for stuff wish it was reverted to the old layout but kept the new interface. I like using the application because I am totally blind. And it works great with accessibilities. I mean who doesn't love Amazon. I think it's become apart of everyone's life. I've been using this Amazon shopping app for a long time and I've never experienced any problems of any kind with it. If you're not using this app, then you should.

The old app was much better, the new UI is pathetic, takes a lot more clicks to get to where you want in your account, to make it worse in the chat function with customer care the Google keypad overlays the chat box and what you type is hidden behind the keyboard! recent issues that have made it hard to use lately: the "view in your room" feature works sometimes, but when it doesn't, the placement grid produces a rapidly flashing black and white square. it luckily just gives me a headache, but could serve very dangerous for anyone with epilepsy etc. when i click lists, it automatically defaults to the same list no matter what i do instead of showing me all my wishlists. its not even one i open the most often, besides the fact it opens every time autom.

Easy enough to use but the most recent updates are AWFUL. The old interface looked nicer and was much easier to navigate. Hate the Update - This app used to work well, now it's just frustrating. Whenever I click on an item, the description flashes for a split second, then it disappears forever. I never know if I'm looking at the right item. It also takes ages for options to appear. Please change back!

My main first source of shopping for entertainment: (movies/music/other misc...). Quick, easy, and really fast shipping especially on Amazon backed products! Every time I click a link on the Internet that is supposed to take me to the Amazon shopping app it just freezes and shows the Amazon shopping app bar on the top of the screen and it doesn't actually ever open the app. Very annoying. Changes or updates made in October 2021 caused this app and the browser version of Amazon to be just awful. Everything else on my phone is fast and responsive. Only Amazon is slow and unusable. On a positive note, I'm finding better deals on competitor's sites that function normally.

PRIME SHIPPING NEVER SHIPS ON TIME! Also, This is the worst to search for anything or buy anything on! I think I've had 100's of orders and even though a few of them didn't go perfectly, I was always taken care of by customer service people that seem to have only one goal. App is easy to navigate, although could do with better options to find key information as some products/ sellers set their listing out differently. Amazon is very useful to get your deliveries with lots of different options. Pay your fair share of taxes and I'd rate higher!

Latest update is a waste of space. It takes longer for me to navigate now because they moved everything. It doesn't mimic the website we are used to, and the amout of wasted white pace is staggering. The app used to run super smooth, but after a recent update, it's begun to chug quite significantly. I'm on an S20, so this shouldn't be an issue. But for whatever reason, it's become slow, laggy, and unreliable. I guess it's back to browser shopping on my desktop, until this issue is resolved.

Lacks essential features the web interface provides. This app does not allow one to do these kinds of searches. It also appears to load Amazon product pages slower than Chrome.

Used to be great. Redesign appears to be an exercise in style over function. Slow, badly designed interface has broken the previous effective navigation. Not sure who tested this but they need another go. Oh and the new logo for notifications is too easy to miss when scrolling through a list.

This app used to be great. Now, using it feels like navigating over dial up. I haven't even decided how I feel about the aesthetic changes yet, because I can't stand to use something this slow. Every. Single. Time. you click ANYTHING, you wait 8 seconds for the screen to load.

It's not bad, for a rich company could be more. Can't shop w/a migraine, *PLS* make Dark Mode, not invert. It'd be cool to search in all lists vs. 1 list. Wish you could leave comments. Up until the last year or so I have loved this app. But recently it has gotten worse and worse to the point where it is almost unusable on my phone (Samsung Note 9). Love the app makes things really easy The only difficulty I've had is looking up past orders. You are able to look beyond the 3 months and have a broader search option on the actual web page. But you're always sacrificing something if you're switching to an app

Not worth it anymore, they're sell outs to cheap goods and push their own brand Amazon Basic, which isn't any better, terrible quality. Amazon is by far my favorite online shopping site. All the perks that come with a Prime membership make it well worth the subscription price of $12.99 a month. Every since the app was updated. It refreshes so fast and kicks me out of whatever I'm doing and goes back to the home screen. So aggravating. To many mistakes when using the app. You can't search an item without getting everything Amazon wants to throw in. It's ridiculous that the different store's can charge such different prices. Amazon, Stop messing with your app. Frustrating when the UI keeps changing. Sometimes the option appears in hamburger menu, other times you have to look around randomly for the option you want. Amazon's performance has been slacking. Constantly delaying and cancelling deliveries. Contrary to recent reviews from others, I have actually found the latest update to be an improvement in terms of usability - the app is far better organized and interaction is smooth and stable. Of course I still get a nice long wait with every server request, but that's [probably] not the app's fault. This app is finally starting to feel like it might have been developed by professionals!

Never works the first time. Every single time I click on an Amazon link, Amazon Shopping opens and freezes. I have to close it, manually open it, and manually search for the item for it to work.
